I have used the JavaPress 3 times to make coarse ground coffee for my coffee press. The grounds came out as expected. No small grounds got through the filter in my coffee press. The JavaPress looks sharp and I like leaving it out next to the coffee press. The dial used to adjust the position of the conical burr does not click when I rotate it, as some reviewers have reported on their JavaPresses. This is a minor point, and Im not sure how helpful a click would be. I also found that operating the dial was not as intuitive as one would believe. My dial does not turn unless I press and hold the burr assembly inwardly against the spring. Once I press it in, I can rotate the dial. The video and instructions I reviewed said nothing about this. But all in all, its a nice product and does what its is supposed to do.

reviews.reviewTitle: Uneven grind, pretty poorly made, but good for camping/traveling.
reviews.reviewText: This is the second one of this type model I have bought. Despite the different brand, it was really just the same except for the way the black knob was attached. These grinders are fine. They grind but very quickly tend to peel off the straight screw track of the adjustable grinder- it becomes tilted after grinding beans and the result is too much of an uneven grind with too many large chunks, even when I set it to a "fine" setting. This grinder will be added to the camping kit where I will keep it with an AeroPress, which it fits perfectly into the plunger. Summary: for the hand grinding time spent, too uneven a grind to be satisfactory as a daily coffee grinder. I used it for months before admitting this conclusion, becoming more unsatisfied with my coffee along the way.

reviews.reviewTitle: good build quality consistent grind for espresso does not take ...
reviews.reviewText:
Pros:

good build quality
consistent grind for espresso
does not take too long for 2 cups of espresso, in my case like 2 mins max
not too bulky
you can use it with both hands, making a inverted movement with each hand wich makes it easier and faster to grind
good price for what you get
Espresso tastes much better than pregrounded in pressurized portafilter
out of this planet customer service

cons: none i can think of right now and ive only make espresso, so i cant speak for other types of grind.

will update if anything goes wrong

I really wanted to like this thing. I like a fine grind on my coffee to use with my v60. Sadly, clicking all the way to the right and opening it 1-3 clicks only produces a grind about as fine as a medium french press. If I click even more to the left, i've seen half a bean come through! While I like the size and conceptual design of this product, I can't recommended for anything other than french press, cold brew, or a coffee machine.

Bought my original manual grinder after an automatic grinder decided to quit on me. Ive had this grinder for nearly a year and it has worked great: quiet, grinds fairly quickly, and was consistent throughout most of the year. Around Month 10 or so the grinder wasnt grinding as consistent which was to be expected with as much coffee as I drink. Nonetheless, I contacted customer service because it was within the one-year warranty period and they couldnt have been more helpful. After multiple unnecessary apologies, one day later I had a brand new grinder on my doorstep! overall a great quality grinder for the money and the customer service puts this review well above five stars in my opinion. Nice to have a company so for their customers in this day and age and dedicated to quality coffee products as well!

Overall, an amazing grinder. Easy to open, easy to use, and once you watch the instructive videos, everything becomes much clearer. This is a top notch grinder for anyone looking to grind their own coffee by hand.

Now let me tell you why I gave it four stars instead of five. Again, amazing grinder. The only issues I have had with it is when I go to clean it. The ceramic grinder retained coffee grounds in the little ceramic slots. I tried to clean it with a tiny bottle brush and got most of the residue off, some still stayed.

The tiny little nuts that hold things together are a pain. I almost lost them down the drain twice and had some difficulty getting it back.

Other than that, no complaints.

reviews.reviewTitle: I didn't realize how long it would take...
reviews.reviewText: I had always wanted a burr grinder. But to get enough coffee for my French press takes 200+ rotations. Then, for a percolator, I need to change the size settings, but there is no easy way to indicate how big or small the grounds will be. So each time I changed this, I didn't know what size I was getting or if I was going back to the size I wanted for each coffee maker.... But, it's pretty solid. My daughter also loved trying to turn the handle, which was fun to watch. Unfortunately, I'll be going back to a bladed grinder, and I now have a $25 space taker-upper.

It arrived when stated. It is very nice. It is going to make a great gift for Christmas! They will love it. Just to update that I found them another gift and kept this for myself, as my own gift! I really like that I can customize my coffee strength. Some days I like a strong brew and other days I like it a little less all with just this one grinder. I would normally buy a specific brand in different strengths. Now all I do is buy beans and adjust the grind.

This is an awesome device. I watched a video tutorial before using, but after that it was easy to work with. Paired with the Hario V60 dripper, I tasted the most delicious coffee ever for the first time. Since cutting sugar and dairy out, it's been a struggle to choke down black coffee every morning. No more! I will gladly take a few extra minutes in the morning to enjoy the wonderful deliciousness that this little device offers. It will be easy to travel with, too! I can't wait to take it to the beach with me in a few weeks. I'm super impressed.

I purchased the JavaPress coffee grinder for travel. Although I have not yet been able to take it on a trip, I have used it at home. It is very easy to set the grind by turning a dial, but there are no numbers so you have to experiment a little to get the grind you want. Very easy to do. I like the capacity of the hopper (large enough for a 17 oz cup of coffee). It is easy to take apart to clean. I am very happy with the coffee grinder.

There was a learning curve to master the perfect grind for the beans to use in my French press, but once I did Im only wishing I had discovered burr grinders sooner.

Its easy, its fun, I can take it on overnight backpacking trips because I dont need an electrical outlet, and no more goopy sediment at the bottom of the press or my coffee mug like there always was from electric grinders.

Where has this been all my life and why didnt anyone tell Be about it before!

Perfect grind for perfect coffee. You need one of these.

reviews.reviewTitle: Terrific products from a classy company...
reviews.reviewText: I've been using the same small-batch beans, (Hairbender, from Stumptown Coffee Roasters, or Frequency blend, from Intelligentsia) for more than a year now, and have enjoyed them thoroughly. I'm delighted that I love them even more since I received my JavaPresse Manual Coffee Grinder! Besides the aesthetic pleasure I get from grinding the beans manually (and quietly!) when I get up in the morning, the flavor and body of the brew is significantly enhanced by grinding the beans in a small ceramic burr grinder. Fixing just a couple of cups makes for a serious coffee-lover's magical morning moment, before hitting the real daily grind. I am so pleased with this product that I also picked up their Pour Over Coffee Maker, so I can enjoy my coffee, my way, every morning, whether I am at home, visiting friends or family, or on vacation. And their customer service is unmatched. They will not allow you to suffer a bad experience with their products, but proactively make sure you use them and care for them properly. Superb products from a small, family-run business, with excellent customer service. What's not to love?!
It is well built and compact for travel, however it does take a long time, lots of revolutions, to grind enough beans to make a cup of coffee.

Got the grinder about a week ago, I really like it, my coffee is super fresh tasting. I can only get my coffee in beans, my old electric grinder was noisy and difficult to clean, and more expensive. Wash to load and grind, only takes a couple of minutes. I cleaned it for the first time today, watched the video and followed along. It was quick, easy, and not at all messy. Customer service is excellent. I can see why it gets a 5 star rating.

reviews.reviewTitle: Takes forever for a fine grind required for espresso machine
reviews.reviewText: If you are wanting to grind coffee to a fine consistency required for espresso machines, it'll take time. I recently received a Flair Espresso Signature Pro and I've been experimenting with the Javapress to find that ideal grind. I've varied the amount of coffee beans from 15 g - 19 g and it takes more than 10 minutes to grind. The adjustment knob is backed out a few notches from closure in order to allow the ground coffee to fall through. But, if you want to grind coffee to medium or coarse consistency, then I think this will ideally work for you. Nonetheless, if you want a grinder you can take with you anywhere. Build quality is fine; just don't rotate the handle counter-clockwise otherwise you'll damage the ceramic burs.

reviews.reviewTitle: This hand grinder is a great product at an affordable price
reviews.reviewText:
This hand grinder is a great product at an affordable price. It does not have many parts, is easy to clean, and is simple to use. The grind size is pretty consistent, with only the last little bit of beans coming out on the large size since they fall through the gap without any weight on top to hold them against the grinder. It is also somewhat noisy.

I have two things that I think could be improved with this product. The first is that the bottom cannot be fastened to the top in any way - the bottom can fall off while you are grinding if you are not careful to hold on to it. You have to hold the top in order for it to grind, but you also have to hold part of the bottom. Perhaps if the top and bottom threaded together with just a few threads, this could be avoided. The second thing that could be better is some way to mark or provide reference to what number of clicks the grinder is currently set to. I have my numbers for pour over and french press written down, but if i lose track of the count or what setting the grinder was previously used for, I have to start over and reset it all the way to zero clicks.

I recently was talking with a coffee aficionado friend who owns her own roasting company. When she heard I was not grinding my beans daily she almost had a heart attack. "Beans oxidize within 20 minutes of a grind," she told me. She insisted I invest in a solid burr grinder. They are really expensive and a lot of the automatic burr grinders I found over my budget. I was interested in the cheaper manual option and purchased this grinder.

At first I was really not a fan and even considered returning it because of the time it took just to grind enough for a single cup. However, I got use to it fairly quickly and now I don't. I don't think I would recommend this grinder to someone who needs to brew more than two cups at a time, but for my girlfriend and myself this little grinder is perfect.

I had thought about getting a Hario hand grinder, but read that it only does certain grinds well without modifications. I wanted something that could handle fine grinds as well as coarser grinds, depending on what I want to use to brew my coffee.

The JavaPresse grinder is relatively small in size (like a pepper grinder), with the handle being a separate piece. It can be broken down into smaller pieces easily if storage space is an issue.

I tried testing out fine and coarse grinds, and they turned out pretty consistent. It's a good idea to go slow, as the handle merely slides onto the grinder shaft, and is not fastened on with a cap or nut. Make sure to only rotate the handle CLOCKWISE, as turning the other way will seriously damage the ceramic burrs.

So far, I have had no problems with this grinder. It works very well for grinding beans for a single-cup machine (like the Ninja ones). It feels sturdy and looks nice. Make sure to clean it out regularly and it will last a long time.

The seller delivered the grinder as fast as the delivery service could get it to us. The price was good and we use this grinder everyday. i just hook it up tp my 18 volt cordless drill and with the drill going as slow as it can go it does an excellent job of grinding coffee. If you go to fast the beans won't go into the grinder. Go the same speed as if you were doing it my hand. This is a good grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: The best manual grinder you can get
reviews.reviewText: I just received my new coffee grinder, and started immediately to use it. Great quality, very precise and smooth grinding and excellent results at brewing! The grinder comes with a very comprehensive table to stablish the coffee particle size recommeded to each brewing device. I used it with my Chemex and Moka pot, obtaining rich flavor and full bodied cups of coffee. As a plus, the JavaPresse service people were very close to make sure my entire experience -from buying to using the grinder- was the best possible... and it was!

This grinder is awesome! Dont be fooled by its size! I use it every day since the day it arrived. I even took it on my weekend camping trip for perfect fresh ground coffee! Ive had the big heavy grinders, the fancy electric burr grinders that tend to heat up and take away flavor! This little guy does a perfect job of grinding for my French press and pour over! Ya cant go wrong with this one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Poor materials that will wear out after continued use.
reviews.reviewText: I really like the look and the idea of using a grinder that does not require electricity. Like other reviews have said, the materials of the actual cutting assembly are plastic. If you drink coffee every morning, they are not going to last. It also just doesn't work very well. It takes 5 minutes just to grind enough beans to make a pot. Most of us don't have time for that when getting ready for work. I will use this as a pretty pepper grinder, I guess.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very disappointed. Maybe I got a defect?
reviews.reviewText: After extensive research and investing a lot of money trying to up my coffee game, Im really disappointed. I specifically chose a manual burr grinder and reading the importance of consistency of grounds. I used this grinder dozens of times and the grounds are all over the place in size. Plus it never seems to stay on the setting I select from one day to the next. Monday Ill have a mix of coarse grounds, and Tuesday it will be so fine it looks like Im making espresso. I really wanted to like this grinder and I purchased it because of the generally favorable reviews. Maybe mine is defective?

reviews.reviewTitle: One of My Most Favorite Things
reviews.reviewText: This well made little gem delivers a consistently lovely bit of ground coffee to my daily espresso experience. I bought it as an afterthought, but now it's one of my most favorite things. If there is a downside, it's that it takes about three minutes to get 14 grams of fine ground coffee for my machine, but to be perfectly honest, this is the only exercise I get all day and I think it makes me appreciate my cuppa even more than I would otherwise. Simple, elegant, and reasonably priced. Highly recommended.

Really happy with my purchase. I'm the only coffee drinker in the house and use my french press only on the weekends. This is perfect for a couple of cups and now that I have found the perfect setting for the coarseness, it does the job without issue. It's easy to store, doesn't take up very much room and easy to bring with me on hotel stays.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good for French Press / Bad for Expresso
reviews.reviewText: This is great if you only need to brew a couple cups for a French press. For a coarse grind it only takes a minute or two to grind up enough coffee for a couple cups, but on the finer settings you will be cranking that thing for a very long time. For expresso drinkers I would definitely recommend an electric grinder, unless you want a serious arm workout everyday before you've had your morning coffee. But if you use a French press like me, It's relatively quiet, only takes a minute or two, easy to clean, easy to adjust the settings, and definitely portable. My only complaint would be it's a little difficult at first trying to load the beans.

reviews.reviewTitle: Must have for great French press coffee
reviews.reviewText: If you have a French press you should know you need a coarser grind than what you buy pre-ground in the store, and for that an electric blade style grinder isn't going to cut it. Nothing gets a more even, consistent grind than a burr grinder and this one from Javapresse does the job without costing a fortune. Besides my actual French press this is the one tool that has made the biggest difference in the quality of the coffee I brew. Also being manual, you don't have to endure loud mechanical noises in the morning before your first cup wakes you up.

reviews.reviewTitle: Coffee taste is amazing using this burr grinder!
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for my husband as a gift for Fathers Day. He loves the grinder and so do I! We've being using whole bean coffee for a long time and grinding the beans with an electric grinder. We thought we were pleased with the taste of coffee after grinding with the electric grinder. However, this Java Press Manual Grinder with Conical Burr Mill has shown us what we were missing! We're sold on this product and thankful we made the purchase.

I've had my grinder for a week now and I couldn't be happier. I just love how every day I get the same grind which means I always get a great cup of coffee. I also like the support I'm getting from JavaPresse, they are so caring and are will to go the extra mile to make sure the customer is happy. Thank you for your product and service.

Decided to try a manual coffee grinder because my electric ones never lasted that long and I was always having to replace them. The look. the price, and the convenience of a manual grinder was what attracted me initially to the Java Presse grinder. I was impressed with the initial contact email welcoming me to the company and the quick reply when I had a question. The grinder arrived neatly packaged and easy to use. It looks so pretty sitting on my coffee counter. The only thing I have to get used to is that it does take a little longer to figure out the settings for the coarseness and it does take a little longer to grind the beans than in an electric grinder. But all in all it is a great product and I am pleased that I am now part of the Java Presse family !!

I purchased this as I recently began buying and grinding beans for my french press. I have only had it for a few months but I use it to grind 40-60 grams of beans regularly and it has been great. Very easy to clean and maintain and is perfect for using with a french press. Making adjustments for how course you want your beans is very simple and works well. Highly recommend.

Grinder just arrived today but I thought I'd share a picture of the grinds. Left grinds are the JavaPresse on finest setting. On the right, albeit a different bean are grinds from the Breville on a #12 setting which is recommended by Breville as the starting point for espresso grinds.

Comparatively, the JavaPresse is close but there is inconsistency in the grinds. I tried my luck at a pull in the Silvia and no joy. Didn't like it at all, but makes a good grind for the Aeropress on the road!

Also, grinding 28 grams took for-ev-ver! But I'll take camping and traveling!

It was a great at first, but after about a month of daily use (once a day) it started to take longer and longer to grind, then eventually stopped working. The plastic piece inside the grinder morphed and even when I shoved it back into place with pliers it would keep popping out. Super disappointing, at almost $30 I wouldve hoped it lasted more than a month.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cheap, Easy to Use, and Makes Lovely Coffee (For one or two people)
reviews.reviewText:
I was in the market for a coffee grinder that was cheap and easy to use and clean, and the JavaPresse is all of those things. After the initial panic about how to use it, I watched the videos they provide with purchase of the product and immediately understood how to use it. It took a couple of times to get the grind how I wanted, but after I figured that out, it was smooth sailing from there. I found that grinding coffee manually really makes a difference you can SMELL. It is light, easy to assemble, disassemble, and has a window so you can see how much you've ground. It doesn't even require that much strength to use, which is nice. The only draw back I've seen is sometimes the coffee beans get stuck and you have to shake it to get them to fall into place. Even so, it's really not that frustrating since the coffee it makes is so good. I've used it for pour over and french press, both types of grinds worked well. I highly recommend this to anyone who makes 1 or 2 cups in the morning.

That being said, don't buy this if you plan to serve your friends/family coffee all at the same time. Because you will spend 30 minutes grinding coffee (I had this happen).

I love this little grinder, It works great and does a consistent job every time. I really like that it is easy to use, take apart, clean, reassemble, and then grind again.

it has a nice adjustable grind set up which does take some time to get used to, But once you get it where you want it not hard to set it up again like that. All the pieces are small so be careful not to lose any, but it will perform great every time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Screw going to the gym, hand crank your beans!
reviews.reviewText:
I grew up a privileged American, with access to either pre-ground coffee or an electric coffee grinder.
I was surprised that it took work to grind coffee beans based on my lack of perspective.
Like any millennial hipster, I needed an eco-friendly way to grind up these beans.
At 8am i fill the grinder. By 9am, and 1000 cranks later, ive ground enough beans for an army of white walkers.
In addition, these 1000 cranks have allowed me save by cancelling my LA Fitness Membership
I

I dont normally write bade reviews, but I feel completely ripped off. This thing lasted me for less than 30 uses. The canister came out, which prevents the crank from catching. Taking off the top became very difficult. The force I had to use to take off the top causes me to cut my fingers on the sharp metal edge.

Dont waste your money.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love this grinder. Perfect for my French Press. Consistent grind and a breeze to use and clean.
reviews.reviewText: Love this grinder. I use course for french press and it's always a consistent grind. Easy to use and to clean. Did a lot of research before I bought this and so pleased I did. Easy to adjust to get different grinds. Will be buying another for rv camping. Was worried it would be to small to grind enough beans for french press, but it's the perfect amount . I can definitely taste a differnce and notice I don't have a bunch of sludge on the bottom of my cup as I do when I use a manual grinder. Seems like a great family company. Very pleased and you will be too. Sturdy and good price. Happy Girl.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice Grind, good looking, good size....but
reviews.reviewText: As stated it makes a nice grind for my Aeropress. It is also nice looking and a good size. I guess I am just spoiled though...it seemed to take a long time to grind enough for one cup. I have a good electric grinder and am used to super automatic coffee espresso maker. I got it for travel. Even if lower quality grind, I will likely get a battery operated rechargeable one I saw and give this one away to a friend that is a camper. I used it twice.

I was very excited to use this based on the many glowing reviews but was utterly disappointed. Regardless of the setting used, I could never achieve a consistent ground fineness. I tried all the settings, super fine through coarse, but the resulting ground was always a mixed bag of fine to coarse. It seems like the burr isn't centered causing the inconsistent ground size. If consistency of ground size isn't an issue, then it works fine as a grinder. It does take quite a bit of effort to grind enough coffee for a cup but it's to be expected from a manual grinder this size.

reviews.reviewTitle: A Perfectly Even Grind, Wherever You Are
reviews.reviewText:
My partner recently got really into making the perfect cup of coffee and I've been totally feeding the habit. I purchased this grinder for his birthday because the old grinder he was using was producing a very uneven grind and we didn't want to spend too much money on an electric burr grinder. This little thing is honestly amazing!
It takes a few minutes to understand how all the pieces fit together, but the instructions were pretty clear. We tested out a few different settings using a couple beans each until we found the perfect consistency and then ground enough for a pour over. It was the most beautifully even grind I've ever seen and the coffee was delicious!
His favorite part is how he can adjust the grind so precisely to get the exact consistency he likes for the perfect pour over. We're also big campers and before he would have to measure out individual portions of ground coffee in ziplock bags and a few days in, the coffee would begin to lose its freshness. It's so great to be able to grind the beans wherever we end up, so there's always the possibility of a perfect cup!

I've used mine daily for 2 months now and have to say it does everything I'd ask. Quality build, precision feel, easy to use and adjust (if necessary), and makes great coffee. This is my first time grinding my own beans and I'll have to say I really enjoy the process even if it adds a few minutes to my morning routine. This grinder works well for me as I'm the only coffee drinker in the family. If I had to grind enough for the entire family, I might consider an electric version. I make about 2-4 cups per day and this is perfect.

To be honest, I cannot rate the product because it has not been opened. It is a gift for my husband, but I anticipate that he will love it. I am really rating the customer service I have already received. To me receiving great customer service is more valuable than the actual product. Any product can be faulty, but the way problems are handled is what differentiates companies. I am very impressed with the way this company has reached out to me to offer assistance if any problems should arise. I don't anticipate any problems with this grinder as it received many excellent reviews, but I know I can contact this company if there is one.

One of the pieces broke after 9 months of heavy usage. I gave this grinder a lot of use, carrying it around in my backpack or gym bag everywhere, going through multiple grinds a day. I honestly expected it to die on me earlier. Good for the price in my opinion. Trying another one from a different brand now, but still happy with this purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is a nice, manual grinder
reviews.reviewText: This is a nice, manual grinder. Be sure to watch the video about how to put it back together after you wash it. Took it out of the box, disassembled it to wash it before the first use, put it back together but couldn't get it to grind right. Watched the video and "snap"....one little washer in backward. That did the trick and it works like a champ. Perfect for bypass espresso in our machine. The only added feature I'd ask for is a marking on the window into the catch chamber for (10, 12, 14, 16?) grams of ground coffee so you know when you can stop grinding for your cuppa'. In lieu of that, once you know how much you want, a small, indiscreet mark with a sharpie works. ;-)

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice looking, adjustable, a real workout
reviews.reviewText: It works well, I can adjust the grind, It does require a fair amount of time to get a couple of spoonfuls of coffee. I have a little trouble getting the coffee out as I shake it into a cupped spoon but either the coffee sticks together and is hard to get out or when I shake it harder more than I want comes out. Would be nice if it came with an appropriate sized spoon that fits into the container cylinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... about this grinder from a web page about the best rated products on Amazon
reviews.reviewText: Heard about this grinder from a web page about the best rated products on Amazon...and they were right! I have two Cuisineart grinders because the first one, that impressed me for over 10 years, became dull but there are no replacement burrs. I bought the exact same one and it cannot grind finer than coarse. Now I have the JavaPresse and it can grind fine, the way I like it, and does a great job. I also feel more part of the whole coffee making experience rather than just pushing a button and walking away for a few moments. It is also much, MUCH quieter...LOVE it!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Very thin and flimsy steel housing. Cheap quality but grinds well.
reviews.reviewText: Flimsy very thin steel that I can tell wont last too long. Theres a lot of flex to the steel. The insert is cheap plastic and also flimsy. Overall its just made very cheaply. If you want a cheap price than this is it but you dont get quality. However, it does grind easily and smoothly and the burrs seems high quality.

I bought this item to grind beans for a percolator, because the electric grinder I bought did not give a very consistent coarse grind. There were always some beans left whole. Even though a few reviews said that the coarser grind on the Java presse wasn't as uniformed as the finer grinds, I felt it was worth a shot.
I filled the hopper and started grinding away, (after a test grind as suggested). It took a little bit of time, but was very easy to use. The result was a very consistent coarse grind, with no unground beans. I was impressed. They have many videos out there to help you, which I did view. It seems to be very high quality and the packaging is very nice. I'm giving it 4 stars right now because I haven't officially used it. Only took it for a test ride. If it turns out to work as I'm hoping, I will update to 5 stars and already hoping to give as next year Christmas gifts.

reviews.reviewTitle: Solid product with a fantastic grind.
reviews.reviewText:
Pros: I really like the consistency of the coffee ground from this machine. It can be fine tuned to meet any level of coarseness or fineness for any style of brew. The learning curve was shallow and easy to understand for adjusting the grind. It is also easy to take apart and put together.

Cons: There are several small pieces that would be easy to lose if not being careful during the washing process. The Handle can be a little hard to hold onto if you have larger hands.. I hope there is eventually a different style.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent manual grinder for either novice or experts!
reviews.reviewText: I was really nervous about purchasing this grinder, because Ive never used a manual coffee grinder before, but I assure you that you wont have any problems on how to use this one and get great results!! You will get a cheat-sheet for the different brewing styles and the respective settings. Plus, if you are a visual person like I am, their website has a bunch of videos on how to use it and clean it! Im very pleased with the product, and all the support the company offers!!

I've purchased 2 times already.
The first one more than 2 years ago, after EVERY day (two times a day) started to beak down.
I was very pleased with it so I went and bought a new one of the same, so far no disappointment. In fact, it seems that the grinding mechanism (the burrs and the grind level knob) has been improved a little.
Still using it EVERY day.

reviews.reviewTitle: I don't like how I have to take the handle off
reviews.reviewText: Does the job. It took a little time to figure out the settings. I would change the handle part to be able to securely attach it to the top. I don't like how I have to take the handle off, then take the lid off, put the lid on, and then put the handle back on. Instead of just removing one piece. I can see where this removable handle would travel better though. Other than that, it was super quiet and easy. This was my first time grinding my own beans so I have nothing else to compare it to.

reviews.reviewTitle: Broke after a month of light use
reviews.reviewText: I received this grinder on August 24th and just 1 month later it is completely useless. I've had trouble with it since day 1, but I thought it worked well enough for what I paid for it. But now I might as well throw it away. We didn't even use this grinder every day, maybe enough for 20 cups of coffee before it broke entirely. I'm shocked that this thing has so many positive reviews. I guess it's possible that mine was defective, but now I've missed my return window by 2 days so I'm stuck with it. I've spent time taking it apart, cleaning it, and trying to figure out a way to repair it and haven't been able to come up with anything. It's a shame that a concept this simple was executed so poorly. I do not recommend this product.

A design identical to dozens of other competitors on the market, this was purchased based off of reviews. Handle has an incredibly BAD finish. They literally did not clean up any of the tooling marks. One was so bad I had to take a file to it to get the handle to mate with the grinder.

I mean, it looks like they punched it with a worn out tool then hoped the bead "finish" would hide the crap job.

reviews.reviewTitle: Gets the Job Done, Nice Quality.
reviews.reviewText: This is a great little coffee grinder for making a fresh cup of coffee every morning. It is easy to use and easy to take apart and clean. I use it to coarse grind full coffee beans to use in my french press, and it works great. You can also adjust the size to make the grinds smaller, but I've never tried it or had a need for it. The only thing you should be careful of is that some of the pieces are quite small and could easily fall down the drain. Overall worth your money though.

I was so disappointed in this product. I purchased it as a gift for my boyfriend. We read all the instructions etc. and it worked once, just fine. The second time we tried to use it, it wouldnt keep the same grind setting and it wouldnt stay together properly. You had to hold down the top firmly so that it would grind which made it hard to operate the handle smoothly. Not sure if we got a factory defect or what but I was hoping wed get a least a few months worth of use, if not longer. Waste of our time and money. :(

reviews.reviewTitle: nice hand grinder without breaking the bank
reviews.reviewText:
I didn't want to break the bank with trying to find a coffee grinder, this hand device gets the job done.....in about 5-10min...depending on how fast you're able to crank your arms, you will have your preferred grind in a matter of minutes.

Pros:
-Sleek
-Im able to get my perfect desired grind for my preference
-sturdy

Cons:
-it can be a little tricky to take apart to clean and put together, so please remember each step you took to remove the device
-uneven grinds, some of my coffee enthusiast friends state that their is an inconsistency with the grind and it could throw the whole espresso or coffee cup up....

Great little coffee grinder. Gives really consistent grind fineness. Small and lightweight. Easy to use. Feels good while grinding. Only downfall is that it is slow. I use it for single shots and it takes about 60 seconds of grinding for a single shot. It is ok for me because I am usually just doing a single serving. If you are grinding enough for a whole pot, this grinder will take a several minutes.

reviews.reviewTitle: First burr grinder so what do I know.
reviews.reviewText: Although I dont travel with it, it is compact enough to carry. Takes more hand cranking than expected for course coffee to use w/ French press and it creates more powdery residue than expected on coarsest setting. I do admit this is my first burr grinder so it may be working perfectly. Grinding is easy but after the novelty of first time grinding coffee It gets old but worth it for a better coffee.

Its 4 months and it already broke. And it only grinds one grind. Fine. Even still, the grind in the beginning isnt the same as the end of the grind. I guess ill habe to go bavk to the old brand. At least that brandblasted a year before it broke. Oh, and the center rod is wobbly. It started getting ablittle wobbly last week, but feels like its gonna snap any day.

Delivery as promised, No sign this was ever used - BRAND NEW. The grind adjustment screw/knob on bottom allows adjustment from fine grind (tightened) to very coarse. When loosened for coarse grind, there is a bit of wobble evident from moving the adjustment knob at coarse setting, but I did not see any problem with the ground coffee. Probably not as rigid as the Turkish coffee grinder I bought 40 yrs ago, but then what is?

reviews.reviewTitle: This grinder will work fine for most everyday use, but I would recommend to coffee aficionados to invest in another model.
reviews.reviewText: Great customer service (5 stars!)! Coffee grinder (3 stars). Overall: 4 stars. The inside of the ceramic burr is made of plastic and can wear out easily, especially with "harder" coffee beans. Once this happens, the grinder is no longer usable. JavaPresse sent me a free replacement ceramic burr as well as a brand new grinder when this happened. This grinder will work fine for most everyday use, but I would recommend to coffee aficionados to invest in another model (Porlex, Hario, or Handground).

Works better than advertised, hand crank is extra length to reduce effort but is not permanently attached to save space. This unit is compact, efficient and well-made. Highly recommended. It is durable enough to have survived several military deployments where its value as a morale booster cannot be overstated. If there's something wrong with it, I haven't found it.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's big but it does the job very well at a great price, pairs with aeropress
reviews.reviewText: Other ceramic burr grinders mostly use this same set you find here. They eventually wear down. With this you can just by a new one for cheap instead of replacing another $60-100 high end ceramic, which I've owned and love, but will not buy again since it does eventually dull. This unit is big, but it still slides into the aeropress (a must), and not the smoothest and japanese-like experience but this is really sensible.

Second time I've purchased this style of coffee grinder (different brand but identical product) and they seem to pretty much be the same. This product would work splendidly if the conical but grinder wasn't always offset. This causes grinds to never be consistent. Would not recommend.

What can I say for the price I was more than satisfied at this little grinder. This thing feels solid and not cheap when it is being used. The grinder can be adjusted for finer or more course grind which is nice to have. The grind itself is very even and much better than other grinders I have had in the past. Being able to break the grinder down is nice for travel. The only thing that bothers me is the amount of effort it takes to grind my beans, but it is a manual grinder so I can't get to beat up about it. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who wants a solid burr grinder but does not want to pay an arm and a leg

I love this little guy! Its just right for everything. At the moment, I use a Keurig machine and this makes the perfect amount for those cups, though more is absoultly possible. It took me a bit to decide what grind I like but that is because Ive never had to choose before. Its perfectly hand sized, and takes up no room on the counter or cabinet. Easy to clean and maintain. I cant wait to start buying more whole bean coffees! Thank you!!

I was looking for a device to provide multiple grind types, but not take up a lot of space in my kitchen. Id been looking at high end electric machines, but after reading all the positive reviews I decided on this one. GREAT CHOICE! Simple to use, clean, store and most importantly it works!
When I had a question about what grind type to use for a Kuerig (medium 7-9) I had replied to a marketing email from the company following up on my satisfaction level. To my surprise, I didnt get an automatic reject from a server, but a friendly response and answer from a person! WOW! They really stand behind their product and are great to do business with...refreshing!

I always make my coffee one cup at a time, so this grinder is perfect for me. Very quiet so I can grind beans early in the morning without waking everyone up. I had an electric burr grinder that was very noisy and got grounds everywhere, so this is a great improvement. Customer service follow-up to see how I liked the grinder was appreciated.

reviews.reviewTitle: I have to compliment Raj on doing his absolute best in taking care of me
reviews.reviewText:
Customer service. I have to compliment Raj on doing his absolute best in taking care of me. I was disappointed when the product first arrived and was defected with minor cosmetic issues. I take photos and email JavaPresse and within ten minutes I get a courteous reply from Raj. He's incredibly apologetic. He issues me a refund and rush ships me a new one. Anytime I had a question, I'd email and I'd get a reply within minutes. Raj made sure I received the new product and that everything was to my satisfaction. And it was. The second grinder was defect free and works like a charm. My girlfriend loves it. It's really the perfect gift for any coffee aficionados, boy or girl. You don't need muscles to work this grinder. The only thing that could elevate this product is if there was a brush to clean it with but it's not a deal breaker. It's easy to wash and take care of.

There's a lot of other manual grinders out there that look the same, but I'm happy with JavaPresse. I know that if I have any future questions or issues, I'll be taken care of.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sloooooooooow and oh yeah, easy to spill all your hard earned grinds
reviews.reviewText:
The good: Clean look. Somewhat quiet but its hand crank, not sure how it wouldnt be.

The bad: OMG it takes forever. I've grinded a single cup worth of beans for almost fifteen minutes. Granted I'm at a pretty fine setting of 4 for Aeropress but still, how is this possible or as intended?

Also bad; why not in some way make the lower half where grindings are collected affix to the devise. Twice now after grinding for 15 minutes I bumped the device over and spilled my prescious grindings on the floor. There should be a more secure means for holding the device together.

Probably going to make its way to Goodwill or Facebook marketplace since Im outside if my 39 day return period. Disappointing.

Overall I think this coffee grinder does a great job for what it is intended for. When grinding on the finer settings, it does give your arm a very good workout, but that is to be expected. It does produce a consistent grind. One suggestion for the instructions. In order to change the grind setting I found that you need to have the handle attached. It might be helpful to mention this. It was also not clear how to determine the starting point for counting clicks. I had to turn clockwise until I could turn no more, which was quite a bit of force, and I wondered if I was doing it correctly. I guess it would help to know which setting it is on when it is shipped. Also I feel it would be better to clockwise rather than right in the directions.

This burr grinder is fantastic. I use it virtually every time I make coffee for myself or one other person. It performs exactly as advertised. Because you have to turn the hand crank many, many time to grind the coffee, especially for fine grind, I wouldn't recommend this product if you routinely make pots of coffee. For that application a larger electric burr grinder would be more appropriate.

This is not a 5 star product but it works well. The grinder is pretty cheaply made and I don't believe the price I paid was worth it but when you're in a pinch for a grinder while on deployment, that doesn't matter. The consistency of the grind is about 85% but its understandable considering the burrs are plastic.

I've had the JavaPresse for almost a week and it gives a perfect coarse grind for my coffee press. The instructions were great it helping me determine the right adjustment to go from fine grind to coarse grind. The size is also perfect... it grinds 8 tablespoon scoops. Customer service is excellent & personal; with follow-up to make sure you are satisfied with the JavaPresse, packaging, delivery & service. Very happy!

I cut my thumb on the sharp edge of the top cap while grinding coffee. Sharp edges are another sign of cheap quality. Not worth $25. My 8 y.o. Hario grinder works better than this and it never cut me.

reviews.reviewTitle: PERFECT FOR THE OUTDOORSMAN/WOMAN. IF YOU LIKE COFFEE YOU'LL WANT TO GET A KIT.
reviews.reviewText: Nice compact size, looks like it will be great for my intended purpose of having a grinder for camping, fishing and hunting. I haven't got to use it yet but it looks like it will work just fine, it has an adjustable grind inside. I need course ground coffee to go along with my French Press coffee pot. I got the JavaPresse Manual Coffee Grinder, The LINKYO French Press Coffee Maker, and MyLifeUNIT Stainless Steel Insulated Coffee Cups. I don't think it can get much better than that.

Our Cuisinart burr grinder finally died after almost 10 long years of hard, every day service, so in a pinch I bought this. It's forced us to be meditative while we grind our beans in the morning, and I've come to appreciate that repetitive and mindful motion vs. the loud BRRRRRRRR of the grinder. So we haven't replaced the burr grinder just yet.

reviews.reviewTitle: Takes too long to grind beans
reviews.reviewText: It does grind well. The only problem is that it takes FOREVER to grind even the slightest amount of beans. It takes me over four minutes to grind two scoops for my AeroPress. Love the size also, but I will regrettably be returning this, as I do not want to wait so long or work this hard to get a cup of coffee in the morning.

I've been using mine for about a week and I really like it. I can't really comment on quality, durability, or versatility except to say it seems to be well made - it should last a few years. the grind is easy to dial in and it's easy to clean. It doesn't take long (less than a minute) to grind about 20 grams of coffee. Also, I just started using the Primula Single Serve Coffee Brew Buddy. I'm getting pretty good results.

reviews.reviewTitle: If you are looking to make an excellent cup of coffee I suggest you start with grinding your own beans.
reviews.reviewText: My son recommended A French press coffee pot. I had never used one and he told me that it makes great coffee plus he grinds his own beans. He used an electric coffee grinder. After doing some research on Amazon I decided to try this manual coffee grinder. I can honestly say I am extremely happy with my purchase. I am in my 60s and find this very easy to use. I also love being able to smell the coffee beans as they are being ground. If you are looking to make an excellent cup of coffee I suggest you start with grinding your own beans.

I have never ground my own coffee beans and wanted to start with something inexpensive. I LOVE this little grinder! Its made of nice stainless steel (at least it looks like ss!) and it works great. Bear in mind, it is NOT for a large quantity of beans. I grind just enough to make two cups at a time, but this thing travels well too. Very compact.

reviews.reviewTitle: Compact, sturdy, easily adjustable and precise grind sizes - great gift for any coffee lover
reviews.reviewText: Fantastic! Love this thing!! Easy to adjust and produces a consistent grind size. I use it at work and find that I can grind enough to produce a whole pot of coffee in 5-7 mins. Works great for travel too. Expect some extra searching if you take it on a plane - haven't tried it myself but I'm betting it looks suspicious on an x-ray.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use and customer service second to none
reviews.reviewText: The JavaPresse manual grinder was the easiest piece of equipment I've ever had to set up. Open the box, add the beans, attach the handle, and start grinding. In a few minutes you have fresh coffee grinds that will help you enjoy coffee in a more flavorful and aromatic experience than you've ever had. I used to buy coffee grinds at the store, and now I'm all in on buying the whole beans and grinding them at home. JavaPresse was in constant contact with me during the whole shipping process just to make sure that everything was all set, too. They also sent an email with how to "break in" your manual grinder and how to get the most out of it. I'll probably be getting more for gifts in the future.

I had this grinder for about 2 weeks, grind coffee daily. Disassemble and wash and found one corner of the ceremic ring is chipped already. I am satisfied with the grinder performance and design, but I cannot give it a good review with this durability. Maybe my grinder is defective? I cannot believe it breaks in 15 grinds. Hope I can get a replacement but unfortunately I just threw my box away few days ago......

I have one MAJOR problem with this grinder. My coffee tastes SO GOOD (and so so so much better than drip or French press or even Starbucks IMO) that I need to drink multiple cups every morning, which probably isn't the most healthy considering how much cream I add. So yeah, this grinder has changed my life, to the point where I actually get up a little earlier in the morning so I can grind twice as many beans and have an extra cup before I head out to teach the middle schoolers. Who does that? I'll tell you who, the woman who is addicted to her JavaPresse grinder and OXO pour-over coffee, that's who!

I drink espresso and it takes too long to grind. If you drink regular coffee size grind, it may be useful for you but in my case it did not, I did not calculate the time it took to make at least one cup but I can estimate about 7 to 10 minutes, that may not sound like a lot, but when you drink 3 cups per day, that's too much.

Solid, sturdy, retains it's grind-setting far in excess of my expectations. Using as a grinder for French press. Decent ground consistency, although you will get some variation into finer grounds so I'd recommend aiming for a larger ground than you think you need to account for that. Very pleased.

Very effective product. It does take a bit of time to grind the beans, but the end product is good and it is extremely quiet, which is good for me as I have a flatmate. Also, that time is usually the time it takes my kettle to reach 185 anyway. My only criticism is the inability to tell the coarseness of the grind based on the device. Do I need a finer grind for espresso? Less fine? Guess we'll just have to trust my eyeballs.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is the grinder that you're looking for
reviews.reviewText: I'm assuming that you know why you might want a grinder like this, but you're not sure if you want this exact grinder. And my advice is that you do want this grinder. It's design and build quality are great, and it works just as good as it looks. The grind is nice and consistent, it makes enough ground coffee for the typical french press, and it doesn't take much time or effort to get those results. Grinders like this are usually a bit inconsistent when making a very coarse grind, so that is one caveat, but even still it produces a good output. After about a month of daily use I can say that I couldn't be happier with it.

Awesome and lets me carefully blend the beans and flavors that I want together. A great mix is setting it to 'fine' for a Turkish grind. Mixing hot cocoa mix along with a dark roast and a flavored roast like Highlander Grog. Beautiful design and materials. Its a bit of work though just to make a double espresso, but I enjoy it none-the-less.

Bought this to use in our camper. Works perfect for times when there's no electricity. A little difficult to clean but othewise very happy with purchase. Prefer the Krups blade grinder for ease on convenience and will continue to use that when power is available, but it's good to have an alternative option when needed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use and as others said
reviews.reviewText: Easy to use and as others said, it'd take about one minute to grind coffee for one use. Remember to hold the bottom part in hand when grinding (not just the top part) otherwise, it may fall down which means some coffee grounds will spill all over the floor/countertop. I am not suggesting to change the current design, as any other way, it will either get too tight to pull out easily or if it gets screwed in, it will add one more step, which is one too many. I like it's ease of use the way it is, just need to remember to hold it properly as designed! :-)

Does it grind coffee beans? Yeah. Are the grounds consistent? No. I bought this because I couldnt find an electric grinder with great reviews under $100. But after what Ive seen from this well-reviewed grinder, I think I should have just purchased an electric grinder that would have produced an equally inconsistent grind and saved me the manual effort.

reviews.reviewTitle: So you can say that I actually like the product
reviews.reviewText:
For the heck of it, I also got the Decen Manual Coffee Grinder with Brushed Stainless Steel & Ceramic Burr Coffee Mill, ($10). They are exactly the same unit. Let me repeat that. They are the same unit, but with different silk screen labels.

Normally I would lower the score, but they didn't deceive me. This unit does EXACTLY what is promises to do. Just double the price.

So you can say that I actually like the product, just not the price. :)

reviews.reviewTitle: Fantastic Product, even better customer service!
reviews.reviewText:
**Updated Review
I had an issue with the plastic piece in the middle of the burr. I emailed customer service and they responded within minutes (at 7am)! They are sending me a new javapresse and an updated part to fix the issue with my old one. Outstanding customer service.

Old review: I returned my electric burr grinder because this thing worked so well. It grinds very quickly and the grounds are very consistent. It only takes me about 30 seconds to grind enough beans for 4 cups of coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very handy for quick delicious small batch
reviews.reviewText: I wanted to try this handy grinder to compare the taste of my coffee ground with this method as opposed to the regular electric blade method. I can't believe the difference !!! It takes a few minutes to grind and it's a little hard to keep steady, but it's light-weight and easy to crank and definitely worth it for the resulting taste.

reviews.reviewTitle: Hand burr grinders are usually great for the fine grinds like this
reviews.reviewText: Debated between 4 or 5 stars. I use it in an espresso machine. Hand burr grinders are usually great for the fine grinds like this. If you need a very coarse grind, say for French Press, then you'll probably have to go with a more expensive grinder. Electric or more expensive hand grinder. These smalle types of grinders wobble at the coarser grinds, causing inconsistent grinds which will produce bitterness in a French Press. Thus I knocked off one star. I would like to see the next generation of small hand grinders address this and fix the problem.

reviews.reviewTitle: Can't say enough how great this grinder is!
reviews.reviewText:
A great coffee grinder which we use and will continue to use at home and on family trips between Lakewood, WA and Mesa, AZ. Just no way we can drink motel coffee! We carry our favorite coffee beans in a plastic zip lock bag. grind them, and place in our coffee maker or our French Press. This grinder has several selections from fine Turkish coffee to more coarse when you want to do a French Press. I recommend this coffee grinder with no reservations!
Oh, I also like the clean modern style, very nice!

I bought this when first trying to fresh ground coffee. I am only a month in and I want to upgrade. The lid is a pain to stay on, the entire grinder inside it case is now starting to rotate in its case when in use. If you don't hold the catch cup
it falls of. I'd suggest skipping this one

I have been using this product for a year. It does the job very well, grinding beans fine enough for espresso and coarse enough for french press/aeropress. A manual burr grinder provides consistent grinds and does not add the heat of an electric grinder which can impact the taste of your coffee.

The product is well constructed, easy to use and easy to clean. Additionally the customer service from Javapresse is outstanding. Friendly, quick to reply and always provide good info.

reviews.reviewTitle: Slow process I mean REALLY SLOW!
reviews.reviewText: when the grinder arrived it would only grind course and not fine. I cranked down the adjuster but it didnt get to a fine grind. Took it a part an reassembled it, then it worked properly. My biggest complaint is that it takes about 20-30 minuets to grind 12 tablespoons for a pot of coffee to brew a pot. I dont have that kind of time on my hands, it may work for camping or something. It does grind coffee nicely but I wont be using it.
Super difficult to clean and the worst part is that the beans dont get get grinder evenly. There are noticeably bigger chunks of coffee beans that make its way through the grinder ugh

reviews.reviewTitle: Inconsistent grind, plastic flaking. Great service from the company.
reviews.reviewText: I've been using this for the past few months and have a hard time getting consistently even grind. There's always a lot of fine powder which clogs my metal pour over cone. The company was great, sending me a replacement when I assumed I received a defective unit, but I had the same problem with the replacement unit. The flaw seems to be in the design of the grinder. I just noticed that the plastic in the inner walls of the unit has been peeling so I'm going to stop using this and get a quality unit going forward.

I bought this manual coffee grinder to take to our home on a Caribbean island. The stainless won't rust and it is small enough to transport in my baggage. Also, fresh coffee beans go along. There is nothing like a cup of coffee made with freshly ground coffee beans. This grinder preforms well, and is great to make that early morning cup of java.

I needed a grinder that was easy to use, portable, and would be able to provide a wide range of grinds. This one is perfect for the price, and you can't beat it. Sure, your arm can get a little tired, but that's what you get when you purchase a manual grinder. I primarily use this for grinding coffee for a pour over, and it has been fantastic.

reviews.reviewTitle: it's easy to adjust the coarseness of the grind
reviews.reviewText:
Bought this awhile back when I was deployed overseas in the sandbox. It's been my go to grinder eversince. I so much preferred it to the automatic ones for several reasons. First, it's easy to adjust the coarseness of the grind. The coffee beans smells a lot better being grounded before brew. Secondly, I can use it anytime without relying on electricity. Perfect in the desert/sandbox application. Lastly, I love the crunching sounds it made when I grind the coffee beans. It keeps/helps me awake for no reason lol

My section made countless of perfect cup of joes with this, and definitely helped with the long hours bearable.

Update: After grinding lots of coffee beans. the burr and the plastic part finally gave in. Contacted their customer service, and asked if I could get those parts for replacement. The customer rep responded quickly and sent me a new one. They even let me keep my old one. Really impressed on how they stand behind their product ?? Thank you so much! Wherever Uncle Sam sends me, this grinder is gonna be a part of my packing list, along with my French press. Battle hardened and ready to produce the best damn grounded coffee for my cup of joe HOOAH!

reviews.reviewTitle: If you are picky about your coffee and want to invest the time in tediously wrestling this device in to submission - totally worth ...
reviews.reviewText: Grind. Grind some more. Keep grinding. Don't stop. You may have enough for a brew after five minutes of cranking. On the plus side, it is fresh coffee even when out camping and without electricity. If you are picky about your coffee and want to invest the time in tediously wrestling this device in to submission - totally worth it. But I don't have any other manual grinders to compare it to and was disappointed in the experience myself.

reviews.reviewTitle: In the trash after one month
reviews.reviewText: I've had a Hario mini mill for years but needed another grinder so I went ahead and bought this one. At first it seemed like a decent option but, after about a month of use, I can confidently say I think this grinder has at least one serious design flaw. The core is the grinder is too soft to stand up to harder beans and the metal shaft winds up slipping. The end result is the grinder tightening itself and every time it happens the plastic gets deformed so it's more likely to happen again. I've used this grinder probably three times a week for four to five weeks and now I can't stand to use it anymore and will simply buy another Hario because that's lasted me several years with no problems.

reviews.reviewTitle: If you like fresh ground coffee and want the precise grind you ...
reviews.reviewText: If you like fresh ground coffee and want the precise grind you get with a burr mill, this is the perfect choice. By the time my hot pot gets to boiling, I have fresh beans measured out, into the grinder, French Press grind coffee ready and in the maker. Also packs very light and small so great for camping to enjoy the freshest grind coffee you can get. Recommend for those that don't mind trading a little bit of extra time to turn the handle to enjoy great coffee.

This worked fantastic. Used it for the first time today. Was very easy to figure out. Plus, there are videos from JavaPresse showing you how it works, how to take apart and clean, etc. if you're unsure. They also tell you what kind of grind works for what method you use for making coffee. It was detailed on how to change the setting of using a course or fine grind. It was very easy to grind and didn't make much noise.

I have a Keuring that I use for coffee. It took 10 grams (2 Tbsp) of coffee beans for a 10 oz. cup of coffee. I use the Keuring reusable mesh filter with my own coffee instead of k-cups. I was very impressed with this grinder!

So far so good! It arrived as expected and I have used it twice. Quality seems good and results have been good. The only minor detraction is the grinder adjustment dial. It does not always make an audible click so you really have to remember how you have it set or go to one end or the other and start over trying to count your clicks. The grinding guide in the instructions is nice but does not directly correlate to how to set the grinder. Again, this is very minor and so far I am very happy with this purchase!

And I absolutely love this grinder! It fits so nicely in your hand while grinding, and the handle turns so easily. I purchase such quality beans from a wonderful source and it was important for me to get a good grind for each bean. I researched at great lengths to find the right conical burr mill and I truly believe this is the best product to fit my needs. It's portable, sleek looking, and the price was very affordable. I would recommend this grinder to others. I've just about got the coffee to water ratio down for the best cup of coffee, and this grinder is such a joy to use in my early morning coffee ritual. I love it.

reviews.reviewTitle: I am not dissapointed it works great. The customer service is amazing right after I ...
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this grinder when it went on sale on Amazon. I am not dissapointed it works great. The customer service is amazing right after I purchased I got a personalized email from a representative another once it arrived to ask if everything was in working order. So far I had no issues. It's easily adjustable to the grind you want and easy to take apart and clean. I use it with my Keurig and the ground is perfect. I sometimes find when grinding that the lever comes off but thats just human error and easy to fix the more you use it. I will probably use it a little more and update my thoughts if needed in the next few months. However so far so good.

reviews.reviewTitle: Takes 2 minutes to grind the perfect grind for my pour over
reviews.reviewText:
For too long I didn't realize the importance of a consistent grind of my beans. I've used a cheap electric grinder. Thought I would pick up the JavaPresse mainly for camping. Well, I haven't used the electric one since I purchased the JavaPresse. Takes 2 minutes to grind the perfect grind for my pour over. JavaPresse also has a great website for tips to help you achieve that perfect grind.
Also, I generally wake up before my spouse and would wait so I wouldnt wake her with the electric grinder. No more! Couldn't be happier with this purchase.
Don't think twice about this purchase. You will love the grinder and the support provided by the folks at JavaPresse!

This mill is built very nicely and does a great job grinding up fresh roast. I'm using this for a pour over so I've set the grind to a medium setting. The result is fairly consistent and brews up nicely, though it might not be quite as consistent as what I was getting from my hario mini mill that had the shaft wear out. After making several cups of coffee a day for a couple weeks, I took apart the mill and examined everything and gave it a thorough cleaning. There appear to be a few spots that still rub slightly on the stone, though it doesn't appear to be anything to worry about. The handle and shaft are much sturdier than my hario, and I see almost zero sign of wear. This has served me well and I'm quite pleased with it!

I ground 7 lbs. of beans with this grinder while I was on vacation last month. Approx. 90 batches. Easy to use; the hardest part is pouring the beans into the small opening on top. The tradeoff for all this convenience is poor grind consistency. No matter what
setting I use, I get lots of chunks. It will not grind it fine enough to make a really strong cup of coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does the job it was intended to do.
reviews.reviewText: An excellent little grinder, that does the job it was intended to do. Has a solid build, and it cranks easily. Doesn't do a lot of coffee at a time, but sharing is overrated anyway. Adjusts nicely for Turkish, espresso and regular coffees.

reviews.reviewTitle: takes too long to grind beans for espresso
reviews.reviewText:
Really wanted to like this product, it would save a lot of counter space instead of getting an electric grinder for my 1 cup of espresso every day.
Good:
Grind is very consistent for espresso
Saves counter space
Bad:
Takes 7-10 minutes to grind beans for 1 cup of espresso.
There's no way to know what the exact setting you are using for the grind. Once you set it to a level you like, don't change it! Makes it difficult to use for multiple applications and to experiment with minor variations with fineness in grind because you can't go back to a previous grind level.

The real killer was the time to grind beans for espresso. I stopped making coffee every morning and bought a cup on the way instead. Couldn't spare the extra time everyday.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's easy to adjust when I am grinding for my drip ...
reviews.reviewText: I am really loving this grinder. It suits my needs and I take it everywhere. It's easy to adjust when I am grinding for my drip machine or my french press. I live in a dorm so it's important that it's functional and doesn't take up a lot of space and I don't have to sacrifice flavor in my coffee. It only takes about a minute to grind what I need (I grind them until they fill up to half in the window).

I mainly got this to grind coffee for Turkish coffee. Turn the dial all the way in and turn back one or two clicks. Youre ready to go for powdery Turkish coffee. Warning: Itll take a lot of time.

If you want to have a coarser ground things are easier. Less work. Excellent medium coarse consistency. Definitely great for Espressos, filter coffee and French press.

I have used the JavaPresse for a couple of weeks. I typically make 1 liter of coffee (6 cups by most coffee makers) in the morning grinding about 16 gms (3 level scoops) of bean. It takes about 2 minutes of grinding to get the job done. Of course I am still playing with grind size, bean strength and freshness but this should serve as a guide. One observation I have made is the slow grinding (relative to electric burr or blade grinders) doesn't heat up the beans losing flavor especially if you grind ahead of time. I am now enjoying black coffee for the first time (i.e., no cream or sugar).

reviews.reviewTitle: Cheap materials; slow and inconsistent grind
reviews.reviewText:
I don't care for this item, although it did technically work. The ceramic grinding wheel in this item is cheap to produce, but has inconsistent results and takes too long.

A quality grinding wheel (burrs) would have allowed for a faster and more consistent grind. Ideally, this would be made of hardened steel and actually machined. The cheap ceramic wheel that comes with this crushes the beans, which is the cause of the inconsistency. A machined wheel made of hardened steel would cut them rather than crush, and allow for a better result.

Stopped working after less than 2 months! Very disappointed in the product. Bummer because I was planning on taking this grinder on a trip with me so I could enjoy fresh ground coffee. The plastic piece inside of the burr broke. I emailed JavaPresse company and am waiting a second response back. They suggested it did not work because I did not put the grinder back together properly after a thorough washing. This is not the case. It worked fine the day after putting all the pieces back together. After another day the handle would just spin but the beans would not grind. There are other recent reviews indicating the same disappointing review, stopped working after 2-3 months of use. JavaPresse appears to be reaching out to them advising it was an error on their part and they will be replacing the defective item. Hopefully they contact me soon to do the same.

This is my second coffee grinder and likely wont be replaced anytime soon.

I started with the goal of finding a grinder that could give me a good course grind as well as a fine one. I bought a generic, adjustable blade grinder at a major box store. Regardless of the adjustment levels, it only yielded fine grind. I returned it, found this hand grinder, read some reviews and pulled the trigger. First use and I was more than happy, I can easily get a great coarse ground.

Aside from getting the results I wanted, the disassembly/cleaning/maintenance is simple. Theres not much else to say, it does exactly as advertised and I am more than satisfied.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent product and AMAZING customer service!
reviews.reviewText: I rarely leave reviews unless I am very impressed with a product or service. This company and the grinder are both top quality. They are very personable and even check in to make sure the grinder arrived in perfect shape and you are happy with it. My grinder had a small defect in the porcelain grinder, and they immediately sent me a replacement one which arrived 2 days later. The new one works amazing! Also just to add, I happened to sign up for their monthly coffee service since the first bag was free, and I gotta say, its good stuff! Overall, I highly recommend this product and this company to anyone! I've already suggested it to my friends!

reviews.reviewTitle: Does the job for small amounts
reviews.reviewText: Works fine...if you plan on grinding lots of coffee this will take a very long time. This however would be convenient for a little at a time. Grinder grinds beans sufficiently..a little strenuous on the hand and be careful holding plastic knob while grinding could easily break.

reviews.reviewTitle: Kind of annoying when switching between french press and aeropress
reviews.reviewText:
Not too thrilled with this, but I guess it's on me for not knowing what I was getting into with a hand grinder. What an electric grinder does in 10 very noisy seconds, this will take over 5 minutes to do.

The adjust-ability of the grind is trial and error. Turn the knob, grind some, check the result, and adjust accordingly. Kind of annoying when switching between french press and aeropress.

I LOVE my JavaPresse! I'm the solo coffee drinker in the house, so it is perfect for me - and it is so Zen to choose my coffee beans, measure them, pour them in and then grind... No loud "machine" noise, just the sound of coffee beans. Lovely way to wake up in the morning.
I use this for my French Press, and have found the perfect setting - it IS a little weird, the "counting the clicks" - but not a big issue, as I plan to leave it where it is.
Not only does it give me the pleasure of a great cup of coffee - it looks pretty darn cool on my countertop.

reviews.reviewTitle: I don't usually write reviews, but I went out of my way to do so for this product- LOVE it!
reviews.reviewText:
I work in an office, so I don't exactly have the luxury of making my own pot of coffee, which is unfortunate because I don't enjoy drinking the gasoline that is pre-brewed. My office does, however, have Keurig machines. I bought a reusable k cup and this handheld grinder, and it is *perfect* for enjoying my coffee in an office setting. It's not too terribly loud like automatic grinders and I get to use my beans of choice, and even mix it up some days! It's not strenuous, and it's very user friendly.

Seriously, I was doubting getting this, despite the good reviews, but I did it anyway and I have zero regrets!! So thankful I did.

I decided to try a manual grinder after my electrical one burnt out. This grinder has a simple design (a plus in my view) and will grind more finely than an electric. I like the taste of my coffee better with this grinder. The grinding itself took some getting used to to find a comfortable way to do it. I've a large coffee cup -- about 2.5 cups (625 ml) and I find it takes about 400 to 500 turns of the crank to grind the beans completely for that cup. The customer service for the product is excellent. They gave me some helpful tips on grinding. Now have to wait and see how it wears.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for 1 person use or travel
reviews.reviewText:
The size is designed for an individual or 2 at most per grind. Average 25g grind takes about 5 minutes. Makes the coffee taste better because you work for it. I like the numerous grind settings for different applications.

Easy to use and clean. Pairs and looks well with a pour over and kettle. Classy look gives me kitchen a nice look when not in use.

Well worth the reasonable price.

reviews.reviewTitle: which is not bad, at least I don't need to adjust the ...
reviews.reviewText: I think it works well as a coffee grinder for about 2 cups of coffee, it took me about 3 to 4 trials to find the right grind level for my french press, which is not bad, at least I don't need to adjust the grind level anymore.The grinding took longer than what I'm expecting, though it might just be a 30 seconds difference, not really a big deal. Also like the light weight and modern appearance, hopefully it will last, as I've only been using it for 2 weeks.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good quality and even better customer service
reviews.reviewText: Device works well, does the job. Only thing that can be improved is to somehow make it easy to tell which grind level it is at, when multiple people in family use and when they change setting, it gets really confusing. Product itself is great, otherwise. Also amazing customer service, first time when I received the grinder it was problematic, and customer service sent me second one without wasting any of my time and didn't even ask me to return the problematic one. Second one is working great!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for Travel, but Inefficient for Home use
reviews.reviewText:
I really wanted this grinder to work well. Unfortunately, it takes forever to grind beans for an espresso. I removed the handle, and attached my cordless drill to the grinder, and set let it run for about 5 minutes. The hopper was still about 1/4 full of beans.

If you use a courser grind, it doesn't take nearly as long. Unfortunately, my need for instant gratification and results make me less than satisfied with this grinder. Instead, we purchased the Bodum Electric Burr Grinder, which does an awesome job in a few seconds.

This grinder will still serve us when we go on vacation, but it is not a go to option for our home use.

We went from buying ground coffee to beans and this helped with the transition. It takes about 2 mins of constant grinding in the AM but the coffee tastes great and the grounds look relatively even in size. We use a french press so we started w/the most coarse ground but the grounds appeared to be fairly varied in size we we dialed down to 1-2 steps more fine which seems to be perfect.

TLDR: if you wanna be a coffee snob but don't have the budget for a fancy electric burr grinder, start here.

reviews.reviewTitle: Worn out plastic around crank axel?
reviews.reviewText: Bough it on 9/25 and found this by the end of November, about two months use with two coffee a day. May be more durable material should be used around axel area. I am more concerned with the white powder that keeps popping up. I have been cleaning them on regular basis.

Well made, works well. Really no complaints at all - recommended for a hand grinder. Note that it takes some time to grind a hopper full of beans at finer settings just due to the size of the grinder and size of the grind, but this isn't a failing of the device, just the nature of what you are doing. If you want to grind a bunch of beans in a hurry, you probably want an expensive electric grinder... but for the price and especially for travel with your aeropress, this can't be beat!

reviews.reviewTitle: A Well-Made, Well-Designed Manual Coffee Grinder!
reviews.reviewText:
The overall look is pleasing and elegant.

Its design is simple and performs admirably, producing more towards a consistent grind compared to other more expensive manual coffee grinders.

I find it surprising its relatively low price considering how well it performs.
