This grinder, combined with the proper water temperature and your preferred method of brewing will undoubtedly elevate your coffee enjoyment level to the ultimate top. The grinder's capacity is perfect for brewing small batches. Depending on the grind setting, the hand-crank may require a good effort to turn. I wish the attachment point of the crank and the drive shaft was a little more secure; sometimes it tends to detach on its own when I'm grinding in an aggressive manner. Other than that, it's a well-built, stylish, compact tool that does not take up a lot of space and looks great next to other stainless steel tools and appliances right on the counter top.

If you don't mind cleaning something with several very very tiny pieces, it might be great grinder. Unfortunately, i did not find out. Not worth the major hassle of dropping them & hunting for 20 mins on my kitchen floor. If you drop one outside, forget about it!! I would never consider taking such an impractical & difficult item camping.

I have been searching for a burr grinder for a while, and was hesitating between portable manual one and much larger electric powered one. Eventually I decided to buy JavaPresse for its small size. It is very sleek, and easy to use. Most importantly it does a great job, and doesn't take much countertop space.

I bought this in an attempt to get a good cappuccino from a Mr. Coffee espresso machine. The espresso machine sucked but this little jewel works just fine. You can grind course or fine depending on your personal struggles for a good cuppa. Solid construction. Don't known how long the burrs will hold up but so far so good.
Okay, that's it.

reviews.reviewTitle: great tasting coffee for me every single day
reviews.reviewText: I received my JavaPresse grinder last week and couldn't wait to use it. Although it does take some time (over a minute) to grind enough for just one cup of coffee for my AeroPress, it is well worth it. Although it doesn't match the decor of my kitchen, the design is compact and sleek. I can see bringing it with me traveling as it fits well inside (without the handle) my AeroPress. No more buying pre-ground coffee and having the taste deteriorate over time. It's fresh, great tasting coffee for me every single day!

reviews.reviewTitle: Slow grinder. Get part of your workout in
reviews.reviewText: Two grind enough coffee for a 5 cup brewer (50grams or about 2/3 cup whole bean)this has to be filled twice. The grind is good but takes about 10 minutes or so. Good back up for camping but not for daily use unless you want to use it as part of your workout.

I bought this product thinking I can grind my coffee every morning and brew it fresh. Thats not the case. Aesthetically the product is really nice, but it is a bit difficult to use and you get tired fairly quickly after use. If you do grind it takes a while and a lot of muscle. You also have to make sure you have the right grind size set to fit what you are brewing. I can see this product being useful in a camping trip where you have no choice but to use this product but for day to day home use I would not recommend it.

reviews.reviewTitle: JavaPresse for a French Press coffee maker.
reviews.reviewText: Thanks for the great follow up on this sale. I followed the instruction sheet and went to the website, then played the instructional video. I learned from the video that for the use I had in mind, using a French Press, the JavaPresse is not ideal. It describes the fact that the coarse setting will produce a mixture of coarse and fine particles and this can lead to a bitter brew. For this reason, I have not tried the grinder and I would appreciate your comments on this issue,

I bought this for my husband, thinking he might want to start grinding whole beans. It's hard to find a good electric burr grinder, so this was perfect. It only takes him 1-2 minutes and little effort to grind him enough for a large mug of coffee. He usually does a coarser grind for drip coffee, although I don't see it taking much more time to do a finer ground. He loves it, so I'm happy too.

It's a solid a grinder, I use it for brewing using Hario V60 and Clever, and I'm happy with the results. For medium coarse grind, it usually takes around 2 to 2:30 minutes.

There are similar looking grinders available on Amazon, but something that I believe differs JavaPresse from the others is their customer service. They are very responsive and friendly, even their newsletter is interesting.

The plastic piece inside my grinder cracked up after a few uses, I sent them a pic, and they quickly sent a replacement without further asking. Great customer service!

This is a great way to try burr grinding of coffee beans. The JavaPresse device is very well-made, compact and easy-to use (particularly with the wealth of material provided by the company.) The fineness of the ground coffee can be varied, and it appears to be quite uniform for any particular setting. The grinder is a bit limited in the amount of coffee that can be ground art one time; I've been grinding enough for a 12 oz. mug of coffee, and that seems to be close to the limit. (BTW, to grind that amount of beans takes me about 3-4 minutes.)

When the product first came in it worked pretty good, my only complaint is that one single bean could stop the whole thing. Wasnt that much on an issue until today, used this thing all about 4-5 times and now it's broken. It'll grind for half a second then just stop grinding altogether. Don't waste your money as I did, spend a little more and get a better product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to Use and Surprisingly Easy to Clean
reviews.reviewText: So, I grew up in a house with instant coffee and I can honestly say, holy levels of deliciousness Javapresse!!! This manual coffee grinder plus the Javapresse pour over filter has brought a new happiness to my morning. I am the only person in my household who drinks coffee so this is perfect for me because I can manually grind to my taste level. It is easy to use. I was honestly afraid to take it apart to clean it, but Javapresse provided such great resources on using and cleaning that it made the task simple. Very happy with my purchase.

Purchased this for a spice grinder. The different setting are easy to adjust and is great for all spices (so far) that we have put through it. Do't travel with it yet but I can see it would be very useful.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect alternative to an expensive electric burr grinder
reviews.reviewText: Such a nice little grinder! I just used it to make a nice cup of coffee. Easy to set grind size (I used it for a coarse French Press grind, but it can be set to a finer grind easily) and easy to use. Perfect size to grind enough beans for a cup or 2 of coffee for yourself and seems to produce a nice, even grind. Easy to disassemble for cleaning purposes. Perfect for your morning cup or would be great for travel, due to the small size. I think this is perfect for a single person (or even a couple) that don't need to make a large amount of ground beans or don't want to spend a large amount of money for a quality electric burr grinder. If you have never used a manual grinder, it is quite easy to use, does not require much effort, so don't be afraid of it. If you are getting good coffee, get whole beans and grind yourself as you use them! It does impact the taste! Very happy with my purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not for every day use, wears out quickly
reviews.reviewText:
This product isn't made very well. The handle was always uncomfortable and hard to get off. It became striped after a while and can no longer grind. Also when i went to clean it one of the small rubber buffer rings disintegrated and was no longer useable.

Now it's just a piece of metal to recycle.

Before it broke it was relatively easy to use and good for traveling but it had a very short life span. I'd recommend buying a higher quality grinder unless you only use it once a year or something.

reviews.reviewTitle: A great manual grinder, but adjusting size can be difficult.
reviews.reviewText: It is a great grinder. It works like a charm and grinds up coffee really well. There is only one minor problem, and that is the coarseness nob. It is supposed to go X number of clicks in a certain direction of each type of coffee, but the clicks are finicky. In the instructions it says to turn the dial all the way to the right, and that is what I did. But I could not tell when to stop. I met a point where it no longer turned, but this was too far right, because when I turned it left the particles were wayyy to small. I wish it was more obvious when to stop on the right clicks.

reviews.reviewTitle: I use this every morning with my new espresso maker and it makes the creamiest perfect espresso compared to preground coffee I used to use
reviews.reviewText: Wow! I use this every morning with my new espresso maker and it makes the creamiest perfect espresso compared to preground coffee I used to use. I would recommend to anyone. It does take a few minutes to grind up a capsule full worth but its worth it.

So far this is a good grinder, however I prefer a finer grind (using pour over method) and it takes a long time to grind fine grounds. I adjusted to medium and it was much easier and faster. The grounds are consistent size with no powder. For all but fine grind this is a great grinder. After weighing whether Id rather have the noise or difficulty first thing in the morning, I ended up buying a Chefman electric burr grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: It takes a while to grind by hand
reviews.reviewText: Nothing against this grinder too much, It did feel a little like the ceramic was grinding some against itself. But overall biggest disappointment was how long it took to grind the beans by hand. Nothing wrong with this grinder necessarily; so I give it 4 stars still. But I probably wouldn't buy it again and would stick with my Grind and Brew coffee maker.

reviews.reviewTitle: Compact, simple to use, PERFECT for espresso!
reviews.reviewText: This coffee grinder is really such a great product. It allows you to grind your beans up super super fine for espresso, or larger, for French press. I love how simple it is to use and how easy it is to clean. It does take more work than an electric grinder, but I feel like I get a MUCH better quality with this. Perfect for travel.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great customer service for a good product
reviews.reviewText: Bought this grinder to replace an electronic one that started smoking on me. Reviews were good and it was fairly priced. The grinder was already assembled when I received it. Holds roughly 1/2 cup of coffee beans, and takes maybe 5-8 minutes to grind. Although this can be tedious I think it is worth it for the freshness of the coffee. Customer service emailed me and gave me an offer for a free 12oz bag of coffee and thanked me after my purchase. I haven't tried it yet but am excited to do so. Also small enough to bring/pack anywhere.

Make sure you've got some free time if you plan on using this grinder. It takes me usually 5 minutes each morning to grind coffee for my Aeropress, which is about 18-20 grams of beans. The consistency is great. It is satisfying, I have to admit, to feel the beans getting pummelled by the grinder. All in all, you know what you're getting with this grinder. Excellent build and quality, good price, great transportability (perfect for morning when I have no time and have to take the grinder and coffee to work) But yes, very slow grinding

easy to use, easy to clean, easy to adjust grind, and because the handle just pops right off, it's even easy to store. you have to hold it right along the seam between the grinder and the receptacle because they don't snap together very securely, which is the only reason i'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5. (please also know that hand grinding takes a long time and has nothing to do with the product.)

I have only had the chance to use the coffee grinder a few times so far but it seems to work well. It was jammed at first but after getting it apart finally and cleaning it seemd to be fine at least as I can tell. It's the first manual coffee grinder I have used and I really enjoy a good cup of java. I love how portiable it is and easy to use. I'm very excited to let others know about it and have them try it for themselves. Also the videos were helpful and had some good tips on expectations of use and time it should take to grind the perfect style grind for your coffee pleasure. So over all like the product and would recommend it to others.

If you're looking for a great manual burr grinder, look no further! I had been using an electric burr grinder for awhile, since I found manual ones kind of intimidating. But I started getting frustrated with the electric grinder, I found it was super hard to clean and very easy to grind up too much coffee, which was leading to wasted coffee. So I decided to get over my fear of manual burr grinders, and I'm very happy I did and that I found this one! Easy to use, easy to take apart for cleaning. The window at the bottom where the coffee collects is very helpful. It allows you to grow smaller amounts at a time, so much less waste. Also, using the manual grinder instead of an electric grinder has greatly improved the taste of my coffee. Highly recommend!

reviews.reviewTitle: AWESOME product! Does what it is supposed to do!
reviews.reviewText:
This is the first manual grinder I have owned. I have been using it for about 2 months now. So far, it's been awesome. I use an Aeropress and the bottom piece that catches the ground coffee is slender enough to fit inside the Aeropress. No funnels over here! I also use a Chemex and it's nice to be able to quickly adjust the grind setting to whatever coarseness I prefer. Sure, some people will say it takes awhile to grind your coffee manually (about as long as it takes to heat up my water), but there are definitely benefits. For one, you get some buff forearms and better grip strength. And secondly, it's super quiet, which is nice when your making coffee before the sun is up.
All in all, JavaPresse makes a great product, and their customer service is fantastic!

The central grinding piece is off set. I returned the first one I got thinking it just got past quality control. However, the second one had the same problem.
Turns out the plastic piece that holds the central grinding element in place does not do the job well and instead allows the grinder to move a ton resulting in a very uneven grind.

reviews.reviewTitle: Simple Mechanism. Easy to operate. Get it!
reviews.reviewText: Simple mechanism. Easy to operate. Net result = smooth, great tasting coffee. Haven't travelled with it just yet, but I guess it shouldn't be problematic.This grinder was within my budget. Although it takes time to grind, am getting better at it. Grind for my morning brew, the night before. It appears primitive in this day and age of technology, however, the grinder is in line with my philosophy, "keep it simple". No regrets thus far. It works very well with my Barista Brain 9-Cup. Graduated to this grinder from a regular blade grinder. Wish I had purchased this years ago.

Awesome product if you're willing to spend a minute of effort. Been perfect for daily use until 8 months later when the burr cracked and rendered the product useless. Shot javapresse an email and within a couple hours late at night they were already getting info to send a replacement unit plus replacement burr! The burrs have been upgraded lately so I wouldn't worry about what happened to me. Just awesome customer service, and I highly recommend this product not only for the service but it itself is an easy to use and effective daily coffee grinder.

This little grinder is great for a couple or a single. It takes me approximately 4 minutes to grind enough beans to make a 6 cup pot of coffee. It is a little challenging holding the small tube in my hand to grind the beans. you will certainly get a workout when using this grinder. It is easy to change the coarseness of the grind and does its job well.

Super portable, slick-design, and carries just enough to make coffee for two people in the chamber to grind later. The thing I like most about this is that the design makes it really easy to hold the grinder in place while grinding. Other hand grinders move too much and its awkward shape makes it difficult to hold on to, especially with drier or lightly roasted beans.

Super affordable for a ceramic burr-grinder. I hope it lasts a long time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Somewhat better than a blade-type grinder.
reviews.reviewText: This was a Christmas gift and has been in use for about a month now. The grind uniformity is better than the blade-type grinder I was using. I grind dark-roast beans right out of the freezer and have been disappointed in the grind uniformity - the result still ranges from chunks to fines. I would recommend spending your money on a higher quality coffee bean grinder. I will have to.

Yes it is a manual coffee grinder. Yes you get only a serving or two out at a time. But also..

It is stands up to my everyday use, has variable coarse settings (I stick to just one), can be cleaned easily, and stores without taking up much room. It does the job for my french press, if you are expecting to serve a number of people, you're going to be grinding for quite some time - but just think of the forearm strength you will build!

reviews.reviewTitle: This product is AWESOME for camping trips
reviews.reviewText: This product is AWESOME for camping trips, when you want to grind beans for super fresh coffee. Although I'm not sure I'd take it backpacking - limited packing space. Maybe a con....is that it takes awhile to grind (quite a lower arm workout). I mean honestly it took me about ten minutes of grinding to get enough for a french press. The grinds are VERY fine though. MUCH finer than any machine I've encountered...& I've done side by side comparisons.

This grinder was about what I expected. It works well, but the size just feels small in my hands and that makes it a seem a little clunky. I wish the handle had notch to slip into or an O-ring to hold it on while grinding. With these few things pointed out I will say its size does allow for it to be packed in my pack very nicely. It is easy to use and grinds very well. I would recommend this grinder to backpackers that take short hikes. Definitely not ultralight gear.

reviews.reviewTitle: 6 Out of 5 Stars for Customer Service
reviews.reviewText:
I originally ordered the JavaPresse grinder on June 5th. The product was delivered on June 7th. The JavaPresse works extremely well! However, the base was missing the plastic insert, so the ground coffee spilled out through the openings. I sent an e-mail explaining the problem to JavaPresse customer service through the Amazon website, and within 32 minutes received the reply below.

"Oh my goodness, I'm so sorry! That is definitely our manufacturing departments fault and I will relay the message to them. We don't have individual replacement parts in stock at the moment but I am happy to send you a replacement unit on the house. Ill rush to deliver you one immediately."

I received the replacement on June 12th. An awesome product with even BETTER customer service!

reviews.reviewTitle: Essential item for the path to the perfect cup of coffee!
reviews.reviewText: I did a lot of research before buying a coffee grinder and I'm glad that I ended up with this one. It works great and you get a nice consistent grind. The only thing I wish was that there were settings for different grinds. You can adjust the grind but it's hard to tell what setting it's on without grinding a little bit first. All in all this grinder is awesome though and has helped me make a mean cup of joe!

You may think it's overblown if I said this little gadget changed my life. But it did.
Sure, it takes some time to grind but what did you expect from a manual device??
The construction is perfect, the results are perfect and the customer service is top notch. I live in Argentina but I ordered it from New York while on vacation. All of my friends want one of these now! Specially after drinking a cup of coffee made from it.

If you love coffee but don't want to bust the bank this is an essential an accesible tool to take ANY kind of coffee to a whole new level. Trust me on this!

reviews.reviewTitle: This is an excellent coffee bean grinder
reviews.reviewText:
I'm a single guy and I've used this for a week now. This is an excellent coffee bean grinder. For a medium grind, it takes me about 1 minute to get the job (3 tablespoons of beans) done in the morning. It's easy, quick, and accurate.

1/100th of a star taken off because it took a few "grinds" to dial in what I was looking for. Why on earth they didn't anticipate what my personal preferences were and set it at that is beyond me. But, to be fair, it wasn't very difficult. Even without instructions.

5 stars, and I'm very happy with this purchase! Well done, and highly recommended! Thanks for reading my review!

- Alleyrat

reviews.reviewTitle: This is a nice little grinder.
reviews.reviewText:
Everything fits together perfectly and the material quality is very good. It is very easy to dial in the fineness controls and the grind consistency has been perfect so far. While it does take a little effort to grind out a cup of coffee, that is now part of the coffee experience.

My last full-size grinder would leave statically charged grinds that would go everywhere when you opened the grind chamber. This was the reason I was looking for a hand grinder. No complaints in that dept.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice little hand grinder for the perfect grind
reviews.reviewText: This is a nice manual grinder for a consistent grind, which is perfect for coffee as finicky as espresso. The clicking feature of the adjustment nut is very helpful to "dial in" the grind. It can be tricky to clean because the parts are small and you need to know how to reassemble it. I only wish that both washers were made of metal. But, the customer service is excellent and the shipping is fast! I bought my javapresse in December of 2017 and the washers broke two months later. And I think that was in part due to my ignorance (need to know the correct orientation of the washers). However, the lady was very sympathetic and they replaced my unit. I would suggest a small stiff brush to clean out the coffee from the grooves at the bottom of the collection compartment.

I just ordered this burr grinder and it is incredible!

It's sturdy, and built to last. You'll have some of the freshest tasting coffee with it and you even get a free bag of Javapresse coffee with a purchase, which is amazing! I've been looking for a burr grinder for a while and couldn't find one in any local stores (all electric).

I used this yesterday and it really does bring out the flavor and aroma of your coffee beans. It comes with a handy guide that tells you how to use it, clean and care for it as well. I can't recommend this highly enough!

reviews.reviewTitle: Works very well, small and exceptionally well made.
reviews.reviewText: I use this in conjunction with the Aeropress coffee maker. It is not very quick to grind enough coffee for one cup but it's not too bad. I usually can grind about two Aeropress scoops full before the water is hot. The grind itself is very consistent and easily adjustable to get just what you want. I only drink one cup a day but if I drank more I would get an electric grinder. It isn't hard work but not really enjoyable either. But as for function, it works great!

reviews.reviewTitle: This looks and feels like a high quality piece
reviews.reviewText: This looks and feels like a high quality piece. I got it to for coarse grinding, but the dial that adjusts the grind tends to loosen up while I grind making it hard to keep it consistent. I thought would be nice and quiet for my office environment, but honestly it's just too slow. I'm less disruptive with a loud 3-4 second noise than 40-60 seconds of a low grinding undertone emanating from my desk. (Not marking down for that, just the nature of manual grinders)

The grinder I received seems mechanically sound. However, I need a fairly fine grind for my pour-overs and it takes around 10 minutes to grind the necessary amount. As a professional, I do not have the time for this.

I will be shelving this relatively expensive grinder, to be pulled out only when the electricity goes off or perhaps for the odd travel or camping trip.

I also do not like the fact that the canonical burr requires replacement with regular use. I guess that is to be expected with ceramic. Had I known this, I would not have made the purchase in the first place.

I used this grinder most days since I bought it a year and nine months ago. When I cleaned it, I noticed some wear on the underside of the plastic dividers, just above where the beans are ground.

Today, I noticed the grinder didn't feel quite right. I looked underneath and saw a piece of plastic lodged in the grinding mechanism. I looked in my coffee grounds and found another piece of plastic. And when I opened it up, a third piece of plastic fell out.

I don't want to be brewing plastic with my coffee... So I guess this thing is dead. It was good while it lasted. But don't expect it to last forever.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love it, but patience is necessary
reviews.reviewText: I bought this grinder to take on a trip and use with my AeroPress. Love the AeroPress and this grinder works perfectly fine. Just realize you will be turning the grinding crank for quite a while. Good exercise, I guess. I was so happy to get back home and use my electric burr grinder. I guess I'm just a little lazy in the morning when it comes to my first cup of coffee. I'm pleased with the purchase and would buy it again.

reviews.reviewTitle: I didn't love it right out of box cause I thought it ...
reviews.reviewText: I didn't love it right out of box cause I thought it was gonna be smaller. Considered sending it back. But watched videos, especially one where you disassemble grinding part and was impressed at customer service that explain all that to you and make it look easy. I have had a japanese model for years and been grinding my beans, but wanted something lighter and smaller for travel. This is very sleek and design is beautiful and makes a better cup of coffee than my Hario, but that may be because I have never cleaned the grinding mechanism.

reviews.reviewTitle: It came in time for thanksgiving. I ordered it ...
reviews.reviewText: It came in time for thanksgiving. I ordered it Tuesday evening. overnight. Looks very well made. Did not get to use it because the person that was bringing the beans forgot. I do not drink coffee but if it is going to be made in my house it is going to be done right. The only coffee I had that was OK was in Ethiopia where the beans rousted and ground and made into coffee all with in 20 minutes.

What a great little personal coffee grinder! It does not get any easier than this. I have used electric grinders in the past, and it was difficult to get the right grind. This may take a minute or two, but the coffee grind is consistent. It is small, so it is easy to travel with. If you have an Aero Press coffee maker, it fits inside of it. I would recommend this to anyone who likes a great cup of coffee!

reviews.reviewTitle: Hope you have a Monkey to Grind
reviews.reviewText:
If you want a relaxing cup of coffee in the morning I hope you have a monkey to do the grinding. It will him 5 to 10 minutes to grind enough for a cup for you and your mate.

Not worth the trouble.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great little grinder! Owned for a year so far.
reviews.reviewText: Great grinder, my favorite manual grinder so far. Much quieter than others, and easier to grind overall for me. Also helped with the hand cramps that I had with different shaped grinders, because I grind almost every day at the office and as quickly as I can. The description led me to believe that it gave a more consistent grind than others, but in my situation it really is no better than others. The burr still won't stay centered in the grinder. I've owned the grinder for around a year, and just this last week the plastic piece that slides into the burr has split in two. I figured I would post the review to share my experience with others, and say that overall it is the best I've found. The only negative is the inconsistent grind and now, the broken piece.

reviews.reviewTitle: the Smell, the Taste, the Experience!!
reviews.reviewText: Your coffee drinking experience begins as soon as you open your bag of beans. You hear those beans drop into the grinder and you close the top. You begin to grind the beans and your house becomes a coffee shop; it smells amazing. There are several controls to adjust fine/course settings. This is probably the most amazing addition to my coffee routine since the Aeropress - I finely have pro-grade, high-octane right in my house.

Every time I use this thing I lament about how long it takes to grind out a pot's worth of beans. I want to shorten the handle for faster revolutions or install a longer handle with a gear reduction on the grinder. Nonetheless, it does grind them out and has not broken after a year.

I actually like this..feels good in my hand . I like grinding it.
But.. there was a click you are supposed to hear to adjust it and I did hear it.. but now I dont..and I seem to have to adjust the grind every time..should contact the company I think.

reviews.reviewTitle: Have some wonderful fresh coffee beans straight from Kona
reviews.reviewText:
two days into use of JavaPresse, works well. I got it for our camper van, but am using it at home. your video support is very helpful and informative. Have some wonderful fresh coffee beans straight from Kona. Delicious coffee. I am still fine tuning the grind. thanks

update after a few weeks of use: working well, so wonderful to have fresh ground beans. Easy to use, quick to grind enough for a cup or two.
I remove the handle, and store it with the body of the grinder with an elastic band. really appreciate this sweet little grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good grinder that can be used without waking up the house.
reviews.reviewText: A good and inexpensive burr grinder. I love how quiet it is and appreciate a moment of zen while making coffee. This unit is very sturdy and should last a good long time. It keeps the grind size much better than the grinder I had before.

It's super portable but still efficient. I can grind up enough coffee to make three solid, filled to the brim cups of coffee. 6cups if you're conservative. Everything works as I expect it to, which is more than I can ask for in a product. Maybe the only note I'd make is that it probably doesn't grind the beans as finely as you'd get from pre-grounded coffee. Not sure if that's good or bad, I don't mind but maybe you do so I thought I'd add that comment.

reviews.reviewerName: Save a Life - Foster or Adopt
reviews.reviewText: Coffee is my life, so I was pretty excited to have something portable for my daily caffeine fix at work. I couldn't pack it up for a return fast enough when I discovered that the edges of the rim and cover were UNFINISHED. I ran my finger along the edge to make sure. Did I get a defect, or is everyone else who's been raving about this product superhuman and immune to cuts? I think I'll stick to grinding my beans at home.

reviews.reviewTitle: You get a burr grinder for a much cheaper price than electric versions
reviews.reviewText: This is a handy little grinder. My biggest complaint is how long it takes to grind the beans. I think the video says 1 1/2 minutes. In my experience, it's about twice that long to grind through a full portion of beans for a French roast, and even longer for finer grinds. My water usually boils before I finish grinding. My hand actually cramps halfway through and I have to rest. I have no other major complaints, but this one issue is enough to dampen my overall enthusiasm for the product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great little grinder, Fantastic customer service.
reviews.reviewText:
I initially had some issues with the grinder, customer service was extremely responsive and resolved the issue right away.
I am very happy with the grinder, it stores easily, and grinds well.
It makes a big difference grinding beans as needed vs using pre-ground coffee.
So far this has exceeded my expectations. I will report back if there are any longevity issues.
Buy with confidence!

reviews.reviewTitle: Best Manual Burr Grinder on the Market!
reviews.reviewText: I have now owned this JavaPresse Burr grinder for ~6 months now and couldn't be happier. I receives almost daily use and it still grinds as well as day one. I love the build quality, how easy it is to take everything apart for cleaning and how easy it is to dial in your grind size. This honestly stands up to the coveted Porlex grinders which are almost 3x the price!

I love this burr grinder. Yes, it takes time to grind but yes when you find the best grind setting for you, it makes a fabulous cup of coffee. I use a Aeropress coffee maker, grind the beans( takes about 32) and poor in the water, let it bloom for about 3 minutes then stir 20 times and it makes what is to me the perfect cup.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works well and easy to use
reviews.reviewText: This awesome little coffee grinder just took my morning coffee to the next level. It works well and is super easy to use. It is going to save me money over time because the coffee I buy comes pre-ground, but isn't fine enough to get maximum extraction and I was using way more of it than I really needed to every morning. Using this grinder I now use less than half as much as I was using before and still get a fuller, stronger cup of coffee. I don't know why I didn't try this sooner!

reviews.reviewTitle: So we bought this about one year ago and it ...
reviews.reviewText: So we bought this about one year ago and it broke. The plastic piece in the middle of the grinder area split in half. But I would still recommend this product because they fixed it! They have also made an upgrade to address the issues.

My old coffee grinder of 15 years finally kicked the bucket and after much research into what would make me a delicious cup of coffee in my french press, I decided on getting the JavaPresse manual grinder. Not only is it super quiet (my roommates are usually asleep while I am making coffee in the morning), but it is very easy and fast to use. It took me a few batches to get the grind right, but my coffee tastes much better now than with my old electric blade grinder.

I like this because you get a consistent size when grinding your beans. I've tried using a milling attachment on my NutriBullet but that gave me all different sizes. I use a French press exclusively so this is great for a coarsely ground bean. It takes maybe 2-3 minutes to grind enough for 2 cups of coffee, but I do that while the water is boiling on the stove. Easy.

This grinder is easy to use and adjust for the type of grind you prefer. I purchased this item in conjunction with the Coffee Gator 1L Pour Over Kettle and Coffee Gator Best Pour Over Coffee Maker for Perfect Drip Coffee 1-2 Cup Carafe with Permanent Stainless Steel Filter which was a perfect combo. I highly recommend this product.

I really like this coffee grinder. Its easy to use and clean and their customer support is excellent. While Ive had no problems a representative from the company reached out to ensure my satisfaction and to offer support if needed. When was the last time that has happened to you? Definitely pleased with my purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: Grinds great, but the body is wearing out quickly
reviews.reviewText:
The product is less than a couple months old and is already showing signs of wear. It is getting wobbly where the coffee grounds catcher connects to the grinder.

Coffee tastes great. No complaints there. My daughter likes to help me grind. Good family time. Wish it was sturdier.

reviews.reviewTitle: My first manual coffee grinder and I love it
reviews.reviewText: This is my first manual coffee grinder, it is a little time consuming but well worth it. I get a even grind with it unlike my electric blade grinder witch I will never use again. It's a good coffee grinder and well worth the money.

I just took my first sip of coffee that was ground in our new grinder and it is delicious. We purchased the grinder to have on hand in case of emergency (don't want to be without freshly ground coffee when the electricity goes out!) I am a big fan of good customer service, and loved the warm note we got from Raj Jana, the Founder & CEO, that included links to the manual, and an easy ability to contact the company if needed. His is a small, family company, and now, I feel part of his "family". Cheers!

I like the portability of the unit. Grinds perfectly according to the instructions and the feel or sound of how many clicks for proper setting. mine was set for espresso grind. As you see my barista settings photo shot I included. I take it to job with me to add shot/s to my regular coffee or drink it straight after making it.
Also like that you can replace ceramic burr head piece. Which the other ceramic unit can be replace also but don't know if it can be remove from the cup or cap section.

reviews.reviewTitle: Settings take forever to determine grind!!!
reviews.reviewText: Good product but get ready to spend a good 30min at first just trying to determine the grind. This thing has no youve gone too far left or too far right i literally went thru half a bag of whole bean coffee playing with this. Disregard the whole turn and youll hear a click method. Look at the bottom of the bolt where the black start screws on. The more protruded the bolt is sticking out from the end of the black star, the finer the grind, vice versa...such a pain

Purchased this in January 2019. Was waiting for my then-current Javapresse to wear out. Removed from the box a month ago (May), and noticed that the catch cylinder did not fit as snugly as the one on my old Javapresse. Started using it because the old one finally wore out, trying to remember to grasp both parts of the cylinder at the same time, trying to form a new habit after years of use with the old one.

This morning I didnt. Ground coffee everywhere. Grrrrrr....

I love this little grinder. I use it for espresso beans. I only make coffee a few times a week and like the convenience of grinding my beans as needed. I grind 2 tablespoons of beans per cup. It DOES take a few minutes to get the coffee ground but I can't justify the cost of a decent electric burr grinder for the amount of beans I need to grind per week.

Does a great job. Nice and quiet and adds to the ritual act of making morning coffee. Good for single or double use. Beyond that you will be grinding for a long time if you are going for sugar or salt crystal sizes For more than two people. The diameter of the cylinder fits perfectly into the cappuccino filter. So great for pouring back if filled too high.

It's nice to have freshly ground coffee for my espresso machine. I've had issues with the grind being too fine before with getting from the stores so this is good for making adjustments to find the best size. This is really great if you're just making something for 1 or 2 people. I was a bit confused on how to clean it but there are videos online for that. Haven't had any issues.

reviews.reviewTitle: Well made, not for everyday use
reviews.reviewText: A WELL made product, at a reasonable price. If you are looking to experiment with this product, to see what a burr grinder will do for your cup of coffee, then its worth the purchase. IF you're looking for a grinder that you can use every day to make your coffee, look to a more expensive model that plugs in... unless you're planning on getting some upper body exercise.

reviews.reviewTitle: Regret the purchase. Blades are plastic not metal. Doesn't grind finely
reviews.reviewText: I've made coffee with it many times and it always comes out weak and watery. I don't think it can grind finely enough. The blades are plastic although everything else is metal! I am so disappointed at that. It feels like a scam.

Nice design and construction.. but way too small/slow for other than one or two cups at a time. Two measures of beans requires in excess of 3 "hard grinding" minutes to make two mugs of coffee. Would be fine for a back-packer.

reviews.reviewTitle: Neat little grinder does the trick
reviews.reviewText: I love this neat little grinder ! Grinding my coffee fresh and enjoying my own cup each morning is a great way to start my day. This relatively inexpensive grinder did the trick. Simple to use, quick to grind (especially rougher grinds, like cold brew and French press) and small enough to store in a cabinet when not in use. Itll take some trial and maybe a little error to figure out how to brew, but its easy to correct for under or over extracted coffee- just turn the knob to change the setting! Coffee tastes great. This is my first grinder, and Im pleased.

reviews.reviewTitle: I really like this little coffee grinder
reviews.reviewText: I really like this little coffee grinder. It doesn't make as much noise as my cheap electric spice grinder. It also doesn't cost $80 - $100 like those electric burr grinders. This manual grinder is designed and made well out of quality steel. I decided to go with the JavaPress, even though it cost a little more, because I could immediately find replacement ceramic cones on their website, should I ever need them.

First, it takes forever to grind a cup of coffee. Id say 2 minutes of spinning the lever for 1 cup?

Second, the knob to adjust the grinder (fine or coarse) is pretty confusing. You have no idea where the start point is, but then you have to adjust 7 clicks for drip coffee. Kind of hard to get to the right adjustment if I dont know where to start?

Also, no way of memory setting on the adjustment knob. 7 clicks today may be 5 clicks tomorrow because again theres no starting point.

Will return quickly and just outlay a bit more money for an electric grinder.

Though it does take some time to get the job done, even at coarser settings, this coffee grinder is a welcome addition to the morning routine. The added exercise, extra-flavorful end product, and usability anywhere far outbalance the wait that comes with a manual coffee grinder. Setting the grinder to to different levels of coarseness is easy if one has multiple brewing methods handy, and its small footprint makes it suitable for travel. Disassembly for cleaning is a tiny bit harder than I'd prefer, but all-in-all this grinder is fantastic.

Sturdy and high quality. Produces excellent and consistent grind. I would highly recommend this product. Sellers are conscientious and caring about their product, following up with purchase and asking for feedback. I will definitely use them for future purchases.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good. Easy. On the slow side.
reviews.reviewText: Efficient little manual grinder, well-designed and easy to use. It takes quite a few minutes to grind whole beans for a single serving. I have a motorized burr grinder and tend to grind a bunch of beans for slow-drip and then take enough medium-grind coffee for espresso and use the JavaPresse to get the finer grind.

Unless you make several cups of coffee at once, this manual grinder is all you need. It takes about 30 seconds to grind 2 tablespoons of coffee beans. Ive been using it about a month and have never needed to clean it (medium roast beans, so no oil to gum it up). I use it for French press grind and it works fine for that even though the ground pieces vary in size.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great, simple design. Weird taste from the device.
reviews.reviewText: So I bought this device for work. Before getting this, I was just grinding with my electric burr grinder at home and bringing it in. I love the design and simplicity of this grinder. Something we found out really quick though was this awkward taste we were getting when we'd grind with it. We tested all different variables from changing the water up to using all different beans and still no luck. We've concluded the taste has to be coming from the grinder which is why I can't rate it any higher for the time being.

I was traveling to a place I knew the owner only drinks tea. Yes she had some coffee making items, but..........So I decided my coffee making would be under my control. With the grinder, so quiet...didn't wake anyone up...early riser, and my Aeropress all I needed was hot water, a cup and a spoon and I was good.

It did take a few cups of coffee to get the grind and the amount of coffee right...but don't give up. If I can do it you can. Yes I recommend this grinder. I like the size, the price, and the ease of use and it doesn't use electricity!

So it doesnt hold hardly any beans and takes forever to actually grind. It says it can grind on so many different settings but if it does then I cant figure it out, and theres absolutely no instruction manual to help. But I guess in the end, it kinda got the job done.

I don't think you will get a better burr grinder for the price. I love the size and durability, it makes the grinder easy to travel with.

Unfortunately there is too much play in the grinder to get a consistent grind. Its okay for finer grinds, but wildly inaccurate for coarser grinds. If you are using it for a french press, even on the coarser setting, you will still have a decent amount of coffee sludge at the bottom of your cup. You will always have some sludge with French press, but there is a decent bit more when using this. (I deal with it by not pouring the last quarter cup of coffee)

even so, for the price it is totally useable

It came with a pamphlet, Instructions were to log on to the web site to learn about the product. I tried and got a message the website was not secure. I am requesting that the provider of this product mail the instructions to me. Needless to say I am disappointed.

Makes a great cup of coffee with my Keurig. I find the number 4 click setting for the grind is best when using a paper filter with the "My K-Cup" to make coffee with your own beans. The ceramic grinder is EXCELLENT at giving me the perfect grind when using with Lavazza Super Crema espresso beans. The aroma of the brew is incredible and tastes absolutely fantastic when using this grinder. I highly recommend this grinder if you don't mind cranking for a minute or two. For me, the taste is worth it. Bye bye wasteful and tasteless k-cups!

reviews.reviewTitle: Only criticism is how slowly it grinds
reviews.reviewText: A well-made, sturdy, quality product. However, I wouldn't purchase it again because it takes a long time to grind beans. I estimate it takes about 5 minutes to grind enough for a cup or two. As long as you know this going into your purchase you will not be disappointed.

I liked this grinder, so I bought a second one for the office as well as the one I have at home. The one feature I wish it had was some type of marking system indicating how open the grinder is. When others in my office use it and change the setting, it is a pain to get the grind size back to how I want it.

I have a Keurig coffee maker, and I bought this manual coffee grinder to ground whole beans since buying k-cups of your favorite brand gets pretty expensive. I grind a scoop of whole beans into a fine grind within a few minutes, then put them into a reusable k-cup where it'll be brewed into a fresh cup of coffee. The device is easy to clean and grinding is smooth and adjustable, and can be taken on trips so that you'll always have the freshest cup of coffee ready.

I love this coffee grinder! I dont normally prefer old technology but this is better the way that vinyl records are better. Electric coffee mills do violence to the beans as well as the user. Raj at JavaPresse is right about the meditative experience of hand grinding your coffee. The unit is well made and should last a long time. If you use an electric, stop punishing yourself If youre even a little bit committed to a great cup of coffee, you have to try this.

Very cheap, and does what it should. Have used it to make pour over coffee most every day for months now and it is still going strong. I may break down and buy an electric one for speeding up the process and making larger amounts of coffee. I will keep this one for traveling and camping. Totally worth the money.

This completely solves the problem with electric grinders. With the electric approach, the only way to get all of the beans ground is to go to the point where most of the coffee has been pulverized into a fine dust. Anything short of that and you have larger chunks and sometimes whole beans that remain unground. The manual approach involves manual labor, but it's well worth it. Each bean is ground to a level that you select and the entire batch is consistent. Plus this beauty breaks down for easy travel packing. If you are going to grind (and you should), this is the way to go. I've only had this a couple of days, so I can't speak to durability. Stay tuned

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Coffee Grinder-- Even Better Customer Service
reviews.reviewText:
This product works great and gives a consistent grind. I only use the product for espresso so I cannot attest to inconsistency at coarser grinds. Normally I don't review products but this one was exceptional. The customer service is what made this product get the 5 stars. From the minute I ordered this product I got a candid email from a customer service representative who advised me to contact her with anything I needed. My unit came with a slight manufacturing problem and the representative sent me a replacement unit, no questions asked. Not only this, the reply was within an hour even during non business hours.

Not only this, the Javapresse company gives you access to extremely in-depth brewing guides for anyone who purchases their products and they really make you feel valued and respected as a paying customer. Buy this product and get the best customer service you'll receive from any company.

I really enjoy this grinder. It is easy to use, lightweight and can keep extra ground coffee inside its base. It is also very attractive. I am using it to grind Lavazza beans for my "Americano" coffee in the Keurig refillable pods. Two thumbs up!

reviews.reviewTitle: Buy for one great cup of coffee
reviews.reviewText: This is great. I like it because it involves some physical work. So it is perfect for the single brew coffee makers. But the instructions are easy to understand, I do recommend reading them before use. Good price. I am pleased.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's a nice enough grinder but had I known it takes about ...
reviews.reviewText: It's a nice enough grinder but had I known it takes about 1 minute of grinding for each TBS of beans we would have never gotten it. For only two cups of coffee, there is almost 5 minutes worth of grinding (and that's holding the grinder at an angle and grinding and moving both arms as fast as reasonable). That's longer than it takes to make the coffee by any means, once the beans are ground.

reviews.reviewTitle: well designed and manufactured grinder this is the one I recommend. I'm the only coffee drinker in the house ...
reviews.reviewText: Hundreds and hundreds of high reviews can't be wrong -- and they aren't... If you are looking for a solid, well designed and manufactured grinder this is the one I recommend. I'm the only coffee drinker in the house and I want the best cup of coffee I can get. That means fresh ground beans and a French press. The JavaPresse grinder is essential to my coffee routine. It will quickly grind anything from course to extra fine with a very simple and easy click adjustment. It takes little effort to use and it is very well made and high quality materials... Thanks, JavaPresse...!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: You get what you pay for
reviews.reviewText: It is very cheap and gets the job done but grinders like the porlex are a lot better. The porlex is smaller and more travel friendly and grinds better and has a band to hold your handle so you dont lose it. The only good thing about this one is its cheaper thats it.

I like this little gadget. It works well. However, you have no idea what the setting is. You have to put a few beans in, grind, look, then decide if you want a finer or coarser grind. It would be nice if there were indicators.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good for coarse coffee, but it takes forever to make an expresso and it rusts.
reviews.reviewText: We are happy with this grinder, it works as expected, we usually use it with our French press and we get really good tasting coffe out of it. However, if you want finer grain coffe, like an expresso or Turkish, you just have to grind forever; furthermore, the grand grinding adjustment is a guess work. On top of that, the handle seems to be made from a different quality steel and is rusting.

reviews.reviewTitle: What a difference between grinding your own and buying it ...
reviews.reviewText: What a difference between grinding your own and buying it already ground ! I had mistakenly bought a bag of coffee beans instead of the preground stuff and instead of returning it, I decided to purchase a grinder.After some research,I decided on the JavaPresse. Its compact and well made. I am amazed at the difference between fresh ground an prepackaged coffee. Very happy with the purchase....Excuse me ,I have to go and make myself a cup now.

I've been looking for the perfect coffee bean grinder for quite some time. I did NOT want a noisy machine that only could grind beans one way. No, I wanted a grinder that could grind coffee for my French Press, for my regular coffee maker and for my espresso maker. I found it.
The JavaPresse is perfect. It's also rather small so I can easily bring it with me on my many travels. It's stylish and I'm happy to leave it out in my newly renovated kitchen, it's adjustable to the exact kind of grind you want, but most importantly: it's quiet. Because who wants to hear a noisy angry machine first thing in the morning before you've had your first cup of coffee?

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect with Aeropress, but Takes Some Time to Grind
reviews.reviewText:
This product is perfect if you have an aeropress. The capacity of the container is perfect for 2 shots. Also it is small so it makes it very easy to carry around if you travel.

Even if you don't have an aeropress, it could also be great for making espresso. It's easy to use and you can adjust the grinder to make it more coarse or fine.

I can only give it 4 stars though because it is so small and takes about 3-5 minutes to grind about 2 tbsp of fine coffee. Doesn't seem like too much but it gets annoying after a while, esp I'd you're in a hurry in the morning. If I had to choose again I'd probably spend the extra $20 for a decent adjustable electric.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not good for Chemex drip coffee
reviews.reviewText: Unfortunately this grinder does not produce consistent grinds, the grinder is inconsistent with it's gaps, wider along some sides that it is others.. You can see in my picture how the spacing in the grinder is not even.. Making for finely grinded beans amongst coarsely grinded beans. Not good for Chemex drip coffee.. I do not recommend this one if consistency is your goal.

reviews.reviewTitle: Work for your coffee and appreciate it more!
reviews.reviewText:
Haven't used a hand grinder before but this is pretty much perfect for my use. Takes about 2 minutes to grind up a cup worth of beans and does it in style.
Not a big issue but the cup that holds the grounds has a little bit of wiggle and has to be held together while grinding, it'd be great if this was made as some sort of twist lock so hand placement while grinding wouldn't have to be so careful.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great grinder. Fill it up with fresh beans and ...
reviews.reviewText: Great grinder. Fill it up with fresh beans and you have a grind, takes about 2 minutes of manual grinding, suitable for Chemex. I find that I am a bit disappointed with my selection of beans -- likely I need to upgrade my beans. However, the manual grinder, when filled with your bean selection, makes just the right amount of grind for 1.5 liters of coffee.

I was hoping that the JavaPresse would ensure I would have that fresh ground coffee taste, but the grounds are so inconsistent that it's hard to make a good cup of coffee. I can see on the bottom of the grinder where the burrs are closer to one side than the other which makes the grounds come out inconsistent. I will wait to get a good electric grinder and in the mean time just have my local roaster just grind it for me.

I purchased this grinder for my AeroPress and it delivers! I liked the build of the grinder and ease of use. The instructions were simple and easy to follow. In fact, the instructions were set up in the most practical way -- turn all the way (in one direction) then a specific number of clicks will correspond to how finely or coarsely you want your beans ground. Great customer service, they followed up with me on my purchase to see if I was satisfied and if the item broke from shipping. Great company values and the product gave me exactly what I was looking for.

The black knob on the grinder handle started coming off after just a few uses. The catcher was a little loose and I spilled my grounds more than once. It's a nice sleek design but a little rubber on the outside for grip would help a lot.

Very satisfied with the quality and performance of this coffee grinder. I prefer a manual coffee grinder because I dont like to wake everyone in the house up. This grinder does a great job and it is easy to clean.

reviews.reviewTitle: Grind is very inconsistent. Grinds small amounts and takes a lot of elbow grease to do it!
reviews.reviewText: This is my first manual coffee grinder and originally I was happy with it. I thought it would take just a few more tweaks to get the grind to where it would work in my Keurig but I've gone from 7 clicks up to 21and it still has some powder in it and the beur becomes all wobbly which would contribute to an inconsistent grind. The Keurig just slowly drips coffee a drip at a time and then shuts off. I dont think I would purchase this again.

Just got this coffee grinder a little over a week ago. It works great! It's pretty quiet, grinds easily, is easy to put together, and comes with simple, easy to follow instructions. So it pretty much has/does what it needs to do. I haven't had to clean it yet, so I'll probably update this review at some point to have that. But it works well for me!

Creates a very nice, even grind. It seems sturdy and well-made. I bought it as a back-up to my electric coffee grinder for when I'm without power (unfortunately that is more frequent than I'd like). Before this purchase I was using a mortar & pestle to grind my coffee beans when the power went out. That's a lot of work for a less-than-satisfying result. While the JavaPresse Manual Coffee grinder is still a lot of work, it is far easier than the mortar & pestle with a very satisfying result.

So far so good. I've only used it for a few days so I haven't really put it through the ringer yet. It took me a couple of tries to get the grind to my liking but once it was set everything has been working fine. The package arrived as advertised and I'm glad to be a part of this group. Javapress, I hope you guys keep up with the excellent customer service. I have to say, I chose your product over the similar cheaper products offered on Amazon because of your follow up I've seen in the reviews. Keep it up! I'll provide updates if needed.

Very convenient when you want to grind only a little for one or two cups of French press. Takes a little while to grind, so only useful for 1-2 cups. Highly recommended. Grinds perfectly which is the bottom line.

My husband bought this grinder to have coarser coffee grounds for our french press. The amount of grounds that it holds allows for a couple cups of coffee made with our press. The design is very simple to figure out. And while it does have to be physically cranked it is not difficult to do. I also really like how small and compact it is. Makes for easy storage. I just kept the box it came in and store the pieces in that so nothing goes missing. Maybe a case would be a great edition to this product but otherwise it's great! We are very pleased with our purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: Inconsistent grind and knob doesn't stay in place
reviews.reviewText: Nice sleek form factor for this grinder, but after about 2 months of use grinding for pourovers and french press, the adjustment knob doesn't really stay in place. It shifts as I'm grinding so the setting changes as I go and so does the actual grind. Even in the beginning though before that started happening, the grind got very inconsistent if you try to do a coarser one for french press. You get what you pay for, but given the great reviews I expected it to have better durability. Would return if I could.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great grinder! Even better customer care!
reviews.reviewText: Takes a little elbow grease, but this is fantastic! If you need a portable and/or affordable burr grinder, this is it! And did I mention hoe attentive the customer service team is? Family-owned business that really cares about the customer! Thank you!

This is my first burr grinder or manual grinder and I'm extremely pleased with it. This was a huge upgrade from the blade grinders I'm used to. I've been getting serious about making better coffee, and this grinder has made the experience that much more enjoyable.

It fits perfectly inside my Aeropress, which makes it easy to transport and it comes apart very easily for cleaning. It's very simple to use and the design seems well thought out. I love the windows in the bottom half that allow you to see the grind size and how much you've completed.

It holds about 2-3 Aeropress scoops of coffee at a time and takes me 1-2 minutes to grind all of it. It is satisfying to know when my coffee was ground and to have it as fresh as possible. It is very consistent and adjustable - very much the perfect compliment to my coffee setup.

reviews.reviewTitle: Terrific and affordable conical burr stainless grinder
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this grinder to replace another still functional grinder, because it just looked great in all stainless steel. Now that I've used it for about a week, I'm still very very happy with the way it looks and operates. I quickly figured out how to adjust the coarseness of the grind to produce the perfect brew from my french press. I like the fact that it has a small footprint in my very crowded cabinet. Because it is tall and slender, it's easy to hold onto while your rotating the handle. When you separate the two halves to pour your grind, it doesn't spew coffee all over the place like my older plastic one did. Along with this grinder I purchased the Bialetti 6860 Preziosa Stainless Steel 3-Cup French Press Coffee Maker. And, I'm brewing an organic, fair trade, single-origin whole bean coffee from CoffeeAM.com. I hope that JavaPresse sells a ton of these because it's a fine product and they do a great job of following up with you after the sale.

We wanted a grinder that didn't need electricity so it would be more eco friendly. It grinds easily and is faster than I thought it would be. Ther only thing I would change is for it to have a stand or suction in the bottom to stabilize it better.

This is my first burr grinder! I finally switched over from a blade grinder and I can admit that this JavaPresse burr grinder definitely gets the job done. I give it 4/5 because the bottom tends to fall off. Not sure if its supposed to be like that or not. Adjusting the burr is simple, but it just doesn't really have any indicator of which size to adjust to.

Either way, it's an awesome product for starters and I would definitely recommend this!!

First things first. I had a small hiccup with my original unit and all I gotta say is that the customer service is outstanding. I had a reply within an hour of my original email, and was given a solution immediately. Can't say enough of their top notch service. With that out of the way the product is worth it. Being a 9 year barista using a burr grinder is the only proper way to grind coffee beans. This grinder is a super simple sleek design that will not take up any space in the kitchen. It is extremely easy to adjust the coarseness to your preference using the knob at the bottom and easy to clean. The most important thing with this grinder is that it is consistent, just set it and forget it. Unless you want to spend upwards of $150 for an electric burr grinder, this hand cranked machine gets the job done. I only wished I would've bought it sooner. If something happened to this little gem I would buy one again in a heartbeat.

Electric coffee grinders don't get the beans ground uniformly. This grinder perfectly regulates the size of the ground coffee beans so that I can customize the favor coming out of my French Press coffeemaker. Yum!

This product is easy to clean and grinds beautifully so far. It's super satisfying as well! My only complaint is that it's hard to determine how coarse the grind is sometimes, due to there not being any actually markings to go by. You just kind of have to trust that you made enough "clicks."

reviews.reviewTitle: I use it with my V60 and it tastes just as good as at the coffee shops
reviews.reviewText:
This grinder is exactly what it claims to be. It grinds very well and consistently at the smaller grind setting. I use it with my V60 and it tastes just as good as at the coffee shops. It takes longer than I would have expected to grind, but it's such a bargain vs the electric grinders so it's not a major drawback for me.

Also, the company seems to be family-owned and focused on making sure the customer is satisfied with the purchase. I got two different emails from them--one prior to receiving the grinder as a check-in and what to do when I got it; and another to see if I was happy with the purchase. This is a great product and highly recommended for the user who doesn't mind some work in the morning to grind the beans.

reviews.reviewTitle: A very Slow Grinder that will twist in hand while grinding
reviews.reviewText: This is a nice hand held grinder for the money. However, there are a couple of issues that are somewhat annoying. For one, you have to hold the top half and bottom half fairly tightly. If you don't, the two half will twist in the middle. The other issue is that the grinding process is very slow. I have a Hairo Mini Mill Slim coffee grinder as well. While grinding the same amount of coffee, the Hario completes the job in about half the time it takes for the JavaPresse. Other than these two issues, it does do a very nice grind with very consistent results.

reviews.reviewTitle: works great, and sized just right for use with Aeropress.
reviews.reviewText: It works great, grinds up the beans to the appropriate size, and has just enough capacity that I can fill it and take it with me. Super portable. As a bonus, it's so small it fits right inside the plunger of my Aeropress. And because of that, I can pour directly from the bottom into the Aeropress without getting any on the sides. The aeropress scoop fits right over the opening so I can just scoop up the beans, put the nut at the top right in the beans and flip the whole thing over to load.

reviews.reviewTitle: Can't say enough good thing about these folks
reviews.reviewText: Can't say enough good thing about these folks. I lost one of the small washers during the first cleaning, e-mailed them, received a prompt reply and after supplying them with some needed information, the part on its way. Blew me away. The grinder is well made and fairly easy to use plus I'm enjoying being more involved in the process. With an electric drip maker you fill it with coffee and water, flip as switch and walk away. Now I get to play with it, tweak the formula a bit one way or the other in an attempt to make a better cup of coffee. And as one could guess, I do recommend it.

Great grinder. Very controllable, consistent coarseness. You do have to be careful not to push the center drive shaft sideways as you grind, as it can make the butt components bit each other which would damage the device, but that's just a matter of being careful. I love the small footprint this leaves in the kitchen, and it's nice that you don't have to plug the grinder in. Much better than any blade grinder with regards to coffee dust creation. Significantly less dust with this mill.

reviews.reviewTitle: My electric coffee grinder was pretty loud, didnt want to keep waking up the ...
reviews.reviewText: My electric coffee grinder was pretty loud, didnt want to keep waking up the house at 5am, so I opted for this one for a quieter version due to high ratings. I would recommend it way more for a camping trip due to it being a manual grinder and no electricity required. It took my hubby and I both a long time and elbow grease to manually grind the coffee. I could have brewed 2 cups of coffee from a pod machine in the time it took to grind 1/2 a batch of grinds for one cup of coffee. It sits in my cupboard now... awaiting a camping trip.

reviews.reviewTitle: Doesn't grind extra fine for turkish coffee
reviews.reviewText:
Doesn't grind extra fine for turkish coffee.

Adjustment screw way too stiff, had to use force to turn it far right (as per instruction) for extra fine coffee, but after couple revolutions it becomes loose and grinds medium-fine at best.

Overall material and construction seems very good, it's a pity doesn't work for my purpose. Had to return it and stick with the original turkish brass one (I hate that brass smell on my hands..)

Super easy to use, don't have any issues with the handle popping off while grinding like some say. It takes about two minutes for an ounce of coffee (which is what I use for 500mL) and it grinds like butter. I use a coarse grind for French press and pour over. Find about 11-13 clicks works best. Surprised it's only $25

reviews.reviewTitle: Coffee bean grinds unevenly after 1 year of usages
reviews.reviewText:
I purchased this on February 2017.
From couple month ago, I started to notice that coffee bean doesn't grind evenly at medium-fine setting ( 5-8 knob turns) anymore.
I keep seeing huge debris of coffee bean.
I found out that the burr part where coffee being grind become loosen and it does not hold its position in center but it moves based on hardness of coffee bean which creates huge debris falling and it is also causing grind unevenly.
It's a nice looking little unit but SO SLOW to grind beans. I gave up after ten minutes of grinding and sent this back.
It takes about an hour to grind enough kona beans to make a full CUP of coffee. What a disappointment.

reviews.reviewTitle: not great for a coarse grind
reviews.reviewText: I really wanted to like it because it has such great reviews. so far each of the many times I've used it, it doesnt have a consistent grind. I have it set to the perfect coarse grind but after I grind my coffee beans, I have coarse pieces and fine pieces. I've taken it apart and put it back together, changed the burr with a replacement I bought, ground it slowly, ground it faster, held it flat the whole time with no luck. disappointed.

reviews.reviewTitle: it doesn't have any frills and the crank handle dislodges somewhat easily while cranking
reviews.reviewText: This product is well worth the price. As a budget grinder, it doesn't have any frills and the crank handle dislodges somewhat easily while cranking, but it does its job. I like that it is extremely quiet, which is a welcome change from my electric grinder . There are several videos on the company website for step by step instructions on use and care. I use it to coarsely grind for cold brew in my French Press. One hopper full is about the right amount for one French Press carafe.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is a great coffee grinder
reviews.reviewText: This is a great coffee grinder. I got this for my husband along with an espresso machine for his birthday and he uses it almost everyday. There are many reviews already about the pros and cons, so I'm going to skip to the reason that really drove me to write my review: JavaPresse has AMAZING customer service. I got this grinder about 1 year ago. Recently, though, one of the plastic pieces inside the grinder broke in two (split right down the middle). I reached out to JavaPresse and asked if I could buy a replacement part. They responded within a couple hours and asked for my shipping address to send me a brand new grinder! And it literally shipped the same day and arrive the following day. I was so happy with their fast response and level of service. I absolutely would recommend this to anyone looking a conical burr grinder.

The grinder is well built, parts fit perfectly. I bought it primarily for low noise (my family didn't appreciate the noise of electric grinder at 6 am). But, using this grinder has an additional benefit of the good feeling while operating a well made machine (talking about the tactile response missing in many modern electronic gadgets). Yes, you have to deal with the slowness of the process but, in reality, it takes only maybe a minute longer for one serving of coffee.

Very nicely designed works great. This is new to me grinding my own coffee beans. I like doing it and the taste of the coffee is so much better. I have nerve damage in hands and put a small drill on the coffee grinder and in a few minutes I have freshly ground coffee. Hooking up a drill is probably not recommended and I'm sure voids the warranty however I like the grinder and will buy another if the need arises.

Its everything I hoped it would be plus some.
It does a great job grinding coffee. Has far more grind settings than most people would need.
Instructions on assembly and operation are well written and easy to understand.
Manufacturers website also has great videos.

So disappointed! Worked great when it first came. Arm workout +coffee. went to grind some today for tomorrows coffee and it's broken. Of course the return window ended yesterday. So here I am looking for another one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Grind setting does not stay fixed. Wish I could return.
reviews.reviewText: This little grinder would be great but the grind adjuster keeps loosing its positioning. So, two or three grinds into the process and it's gone from fine to course. I've tried to use it for aprox 3 grinds. If I only ever wanted my beans cut in half this would be perfect. Sadly need even smaller pieces for my french press. Not sure if this is just a faulty model or if all are going to behave this way.

reviews.reviewTitle: Be willing to invest a few minutes for optimal outcome
reviews.reviewText: Ive started using the JavaPresse immediately and Im really very excited to say taking the time to get your grind on in the morning is definitely worth it! All the flavors of the coffee blossom. Im very particular about my coffee. I love making it using the grinder on very fine and using a stainless steel pour over filter. Simply the best. Save some money and stop going to Starbucks and Dunkin when you have the ability to explore a higher level of coffee all at home. The links and videos are very helpful at the JavaPresse site and Ill feel more at ease with the cleaning process in a weeks time. Thanks!

I only started really drinking coffee five years ago and it is typically instant coffee or Starbucks. I have a friend/co-worker who is really into coffee and he suggested buying whole beans, a manual burr grinder, and a proper coffee vessel - french press, pour over, etc. I'm taking baby steps and purchased this grinder after researching for a while. I've been using it for about three weeks and I really like it! Since I'm using a regular coffee machine, I am still fine tuning the grind I like, but I am pretty sure I'll find it soon enough. My only issue was reassembly. I didn't pay much attention when taking it apart, so when it was time to put everything back together again, the manual that came with the grinder didn't provide much detail. Luckily, there are video tutorials on the JavaPresse website that assist you in reassembly.

reviews.reviewTitle: I do like almost anything other than drive-thru (not naming names) espresso
reviews.reviewText: I'm not a coffee snob (so I say), I do like almost anything other than drive-thru (not naming names) espresso. I have a blade grinder and I was not happy with the obnoxious noise first thing in the morning. I was looking for something else and ran across this manual grinder. I read the reviews, which were positive, and purchased. After a few mornings I have to say I love it. Yes, it takes longer to make the the grounds you need, but wow, the grounds are great. Highly recommended.

Great product! Excellent delivery time. The grinder works very well as advertised. I have tried a few grind choices by turning the little knob to the left to get a coarser grind because I use a French Press to make my coffee. The grinder is easy to take apart and clean. I watched the videos on how to do that. (Be careful to not lose the little plastic washer when you clean the grinder.) I suggest that in the video on disassembly and assembly of the grinder that the company makes a new one that is more specific about which way the little washers go back on. Other than that, I love it! Highly recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: The JavaPresse Manual Coffee Grinder is a great MANUAL grinder
reviews.reviewText: The JavaPresse Manual Coffee Grinder is a great MANUAL grinder. I read all of the reviews, and chose this tool. What I had not anticipated was how long it takes to grind coffee with this grinder. To grind enough coffee for two people, we're talking a couple of minutes of constant energetic turning. I couldn't believe how slow it ground. That is why I didn't give the tool 5 stars. For me, this grinder will be my travel/camping grinder, and an excellent one for that purpose. Going with an electric burr grinder for my mornings before work.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to start but not easy and comfortable to use
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this grinder is because it has very good rating on Amazon. However, it doesnt work well for me. I have used it for almost one month. So far, I have found the best way for myself, but the experience is so bad. 1. The screw is very easy to lose during the grinding coffee beans, which made me to grind it for multiple times until to get the powder I want. 2. My arm was always exhausted after using this grinder because I had to hold the upper side of the grinder with a certain strength.

It's alright but I noticed the ceramic Burr is a little off center as I spin the nob. My expensive beans are being ground with a less than stellar consistency. Why make a grinder with this much play? I don't know. And the lid pops if as I grind. Pretty annoying. Overall it's better than my blade grinder but I'm considering returning it and getting a more expensive, albeit more consistent and well made-- hand coffee grinder.
This is a great coffee grinder! I use it daily with no issues. Very easy to adjust. Solid construction. Easy to clean. This will hold me over until I can afford a quality electric burr grinder.
