reviews.reviewTitle: Good concept Poor quality (I've had 2 break)
reviews.reviewText: I'll start off by saying their customer service has been great. They checked in shortly after purchase and things were initially working fine but after about 2 months of use the settings stopped functioning and i was getting an extremely inconsistent grind. From super fine power to super course chunks all in the same grind. I emailed them and they sent me a new one right away. The new one developed the same problem after just 2 weeks. These just don't seem like a quality product which is unfortunate because I really liked the design.

So compact and easy to take with you to work or camping. I love having my coffee ground fresh for brewing. Fits right into my coffee prep box when camping and so light it packs right along for a hike.

Perfect -grinder & it seals ground coffee -easy to adjust...well made definitely a 5star if the grinding handle could attach in a sleek discrete way. I like the tiny clear view -so I know what amount is prepared.
Now I see & taste the difference of fresh ground coffe-no turning back-...ever! Worth every USD!

Great for traveling or camping. I was using it every morning at home for about two weeks then it got annoying. Definitely not something you want to use everyday. Its a 3 minute workout that I eventually gave to my auto grinder which is a little more accurate. I still use this grinder though. Its nice to have and appreciated at hotel rooms and campgrounds.

I love this coffee grinder. It grinds the beans uniformly without the price of an electric burr grinder and it fits in my coffee drawer when I'm not using it so it doesn't take up space on my counter. I use a single-cup pour-over filter to make my coffee, so I just turned the heat on the kettle to medium and by the time the water boils, I've finished grinding my coffee and it's in the filter ready for the water. The grinder is easy to use and adjust and came with complete instructions and a link to a website with more info (which I haven't needed but it's nice to know it's there.) My coffee is so much better than when I was using a blade grinder. Highly recommended.

First I want to say this is my first manual grinder. Having this company put together a nice set of FAQs to watch some general information and a couple of emails just making sure everything is ok. This equals up to a great experience. However, none of this would matter if the grinder was not stellar and it certainly is in every regard. Consistency, aesthetics's, and the grind itself are great. Looking forward to seeing what else this company does. Thanks again!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect forearm work out to start the day
reviews.reviewText: The grinder is great, it does a kickass job. The only downfall is that it is tedious on the adjustment settings so it takes a while to switch from grinds, but it's mostly just practice. I'm usually switching from a coarse ground for my french press to a medium / fine ground for the coffee maker. So sometimes it takes a couple twists and turns to get the grind that I am looking for. Which I mean, I'm not mad about, I'm happy with the price and the quality. I got what I paid for. If I truly wanted a coffee grinder that would grind the coffee in different settings automatically, I would've spent the extra $50. Other than that, the product is great. I haven't had any issues so far and I got exactly what I paid for. I love it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for coarse grinding small amount of beans. Exactly What I needed.
reviews.reviewText: Great for French press coarse grind for one person. If you are making coffee for a group, invest in a large burr grinder. But I am only making 12oz of coffee at a time in a French press and this works great. Adjustable grind to get just the right grind, and stores in a drawer. My kitchen is tight on space, so I don't have room for a larger grinder, so this is great. Plus, since it is completely stainless steel, it travels well. Combine this with my small Stainless French Press, and you have a great travel duo.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great coffee grinder, especially for the price!
reviews.reviewText: I love how small and portable the grinder is; its very easy to pack for the day and holds plenty of coffee for single serve or french press makers. Everything worked as advertised and the design, as well as the packaging, look great. My only 2 wishes is that there could be some grip built into the grinder - The smooth stainless steel spins in my hand if my skin is dry and its hard to get a solid grip on it (I put a sticker on it to help), and that there could be fewer small pieces to make it easier to dissasemble when you clean it.

The four star review isn't because this grinder isn't great. It's good - and small. My problem is that the hopper only holds 30g of beans-max, which means you can only get about 600-650ml of French Press. So you only get about 2/3 of a pot for each grind, or you have to grind more beans. I wanted something that would give me a greater yield per grind to have enough to serve others. Otherwise, this was a good grinder. It gave consistent, albeit small yield, grinds.

reviews.reviewTitle: makes my coffee taste so much better! Nice solid construction
reviews.reviewText: I bought two! Use one at work everyday and one at home on the weekends, makes my coffee taste so much better! Nice solid construction, durable, the bur is easily adjustable, and the nob is well constructed. Its kinda hard to clean, but I only clean mine once a month, or when I switch blends. However, JavaPresse has a video on how to clean your grinder, which makes the process so much easier!

reviews.reviewTitle: I have not been disappointed, in either the product and its functionality
reviews.reviewText: I bought this grinder to replace one I had that is very similar, if not identical, that I had purchased from a different seller. When I had a problem with my original one, I went on line in search of possible solutions to repair it. All of the info I could find was from Javepresse, and as I was going to need to buy a replacement, I decided to go with the company that appeared to take customer service seriously. I have not been disappointed, in either the product and its functionality, or in the level of information and follow up received from the customer care team. If you're in the market for a manual burr grinder, I can't recommend this unit and company highly enough!

reviews.reviewTitle: Want a smooth cup of coffee? Get this!
reviews.reviewText:
I wanted a manual grinder in order to get a nice even course ground for my french press, and this worked perfectly, so much better than my electric grinder. I'm still thinking about how smooth that first cup of coffee was after using this grinder.

If you want to pump out cup after cup of caffeine for a crowd, then this is not the piece of equipment you need. If, however, you want to craft a memorable cup of steaming smooth deliciousness for you and a loved one, then this is a must.

Its brushed metal body is attractive enough, and compact enough, that I'm leaving it out on the kitchen counter. It feels solid and well built. You'll need to grip it tight while grinding, but even though I'm recovering from a mild case of carpal tunnel I was able to do it without issue.

The JavaPresse has performed as advertised. I've used it many times now and had no issues. I have a french press and a Kuerig machine.The JP gives me coffee exactly as required ; I use a darker medium roast and have never utilized a manual grinder before so thought it would be fun to try. Very pleased with the results. Easy to operate, easily adjustable ceramic burr, a whiz to clean and well put together.

Pros
-simple design provides for easy cleaning
-highly portable and doesn't take up much room

Cons
-some sharp edges mostly noticable when cleaning
-per instructions burrs will wear faster if spun counterclockwise.

Please keep in mind finer grinds will take longer compared to coarser grinds.
I was very impressed with how personable the JavaPresse company is and how much information they gave me. Would recommend this grinder to anyone who enjoys a great cup of coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: Bottom (Container) Fits Too Loosely and Falls Off
reviews.reviewText: The grinder itself works well and I had no problem setting it to the grind size I want for pour overs. However, the container (removable bottom part that holds ground coffee) fits so loosely that it falls off when I pick it up unless I pick it up by the container. I have to be careful to hold the main grinder and the container when grinding, otherwise the container will fall off and spill my gourmet coffee. Not impressed by the fit and finish.

reviews.reviewTitle: I use a pour over system and the medium to medium-fine grind is pretty uniform throughout
reviews.reviewText: Been using this product a few weeks now. I wanted to try this whole freshly grinded coffee phenomenon to see if it was all that. So far this product has performed as expected. I use a pour over system and the medium to medium-fine grind is pretty uniform throughout. I've heard a more coarse setting doesn't create as consistent a texture in the ground coffee, but I can't personally attest to that. For me, this grinder serves as a great starting point as I continue down the road of more premium home coffee.

This is a good choice for a manual coffee grinder from a great company, The grinder is easy to set for the grind size that you want and produces an even output. One caveat is that when you set JavaPresse for a fine grind (e.g., to make coffee in an Aeropress), be prepared to spend around three minute cranking away on four tablespoons of beans--good exercise if you have the time and a nice part of the coffee-making ritual if you appreciate the Zen of everyday activities.

I bought this for my girlfriend's birthday in hopes of making her a good cup of coffee. This did not disappoint!! This is a well built grinder that gives a VERY satisfying crunching sound as you grind the beans to your desired setting. I'm not a coffee drinker by any means, but the coffee I made with the help of this grinder may have just converted me! My girlfriend says there is a noticeable difference in taste from her regular electric grinder. The JavaPresse gives much more control on how fine or coarse you want your grounds

reviews.reviewTitle: It's hard to know how great the coffee grinder is because it was my first
reviews.reviewText: It's hard to know how great the coffee grinder is because it was my first. What I do know is that even before I got it I received instructions via email to make sure I knew how to use it and how to adjust it. It worked flawlessly the first time grinding up a great cup of coffee. Then I received an email to make sure everything went well. I felt like I was dealing with an actual person rather than an Internet purchase. I love the customer service and recommend it to novices as well as traveling connoisseurs. If you love coffee this isn't the one you want for home, go electric, but if you are traveling or want a fresh ground cup on weekends....this is the one. The service is great.

This is our second hand grinder for coffee after our last one broke after long and reliable service. We decided to try another brand and ordered the JavaPresse hand grinder. Unfortunately we were disappointed with the performance of this grinder compared to our last one. We usually make Turkish coffee, and the grinder does not grind as even or as fine as our previous grinder. Also the handle comes off way too easily - we cannot complete a grind without the handle slipping off multiple times. I understand that the handle must come off to insert more beans, but the design was similar to our previous grinder and we did not have the same problem. Overall the product gets the job done, but I believe there are other, cheaper options out there that are better than this one.

This grinder is great. If you are looking for your first manual grinder, and you don't want to step up to anything like a Hario Skerton or similar, this is the grinder for you. My only gripe is that the grinds that come from it when I use it on a medium fine setting are slightly uneven. It is very minor, but I figure it is worth mentioning. JavaPresse has some of the greatest customer service in the world, and they're a fantastic bunch of people, so I do recommend this product.

This grinder does a wonderful job of grinding. Naturally it takes a little time but it will be perfect for motorcycle trips and other travel for a perfect cup of coffee with the Aeropress. Customer service and follow up is great also!

The machine is very easy to use. Place for a good portion of coffee beans. You can set the grinder to course or fine depending upon your needs at the moment . The ground coffee is contained in an easy to remove bin. You can see the amount of coffee being ground. The cranking handle is super easy to put on and remove. All parts seem to be if high quality. I look forward to many years of service.

Very nice product. High quality. My brother loves his too! I like the hands on approach to grinding and you can grind as little as you wish whereas with an electric burr grinder it is not possible to do that (at least not with the two I have owned). The company seems very responsive and is family owned. I am very happy with this purchase.

I bought this grinder to prepare cold brew coffee since the beans need to be ground to a coarse consistency. But it takes so long using this device that I tried an older, electric grinder that seemed to do a good job. Disappointed in how long the grinding takes.

reviews.reviewTitle: Will take time to find right grind size
reviews.reviewText: Use it every day for pour over. Takes about a minute to grind 2 cups worth of beans. But dont follow the sizing guide in the pamphlet, youll need to adjust farther to get the right grind.

Gets the job done. I really like the size. Almost bought an electric burr grinder and I'm really happy I didn't. This does a great job without being yet another gadget taking up counter space. The grind size on this is easy to set and change. Grinding for two of us in only a couple minutes. Cleans easily. The only thing I would change is to put a swivel knob on the handle but this is really a minor preference.

This grinder works perfectly and is super-easy to assemble and use - even my toddler can grind beans with it (she loves to help). It does take some time to grind enough for a batch of joe, but the flavor from freshly-ground beans is worth the elbow grease. And not having to do much - if anything - in the way of cleaning it is a HUGE "win" in my playbook.
Not good for spices. There is nothing forcing the spices to go down in the grind cogs so unless you pre grind they don't go down and it doesn't work. Waste of your money. I wouldn't recommend.

It's easy to use and gets a pretty even grind all across. There's also no metallic taste that rubs off onto the coffee. The only troubles I have is that it could sometimes be a bit troublesome to load the grinder and a bit of work to clean.

reviews.reviewTitle: Weak metal makes this a short-lived product
reviews.reviewText: As other reviews mentioned, this is a time-consuming process and a bit of a workout. But the real problem is that after intermittent use for about four months, the hole where the handle attaches to the grinder sheared into a circle, so it no longer grabs the mechanism. The whole thing is effectively useless at this point.

This is the my first grinder so I haven't got a chance to compare it with other brands yet. Overall it is a very classy product, does its job, portable, easy to assemble and disassemble once you go over it through the online video tutorials(The tutorials were rather unclear which way the washers--the metal and plastic rings, were supposed to face, though). I am grinding for an espresso machine and the 4~5 clicks setup does give the perfect salt size coffee for my brewer. The only thing I don't like about it is you need to readjust the burr after each grind. Somehow it doesn't like stay to where it was originally set, weird...

This works fairly well. Ive had a few issues with inconsistent grind sizes, but for the price and convenience I cant complain. It is surprisingly noisy though. Not as much as an electric grinder, but enough to wake me up in the morning.

reviews.reviewTitle: Beautiful product, Outstanding company, well worth the money
reviews.reviewText: This was my first hand crank-burr grinder I have ever had. The product itself is beautiful and very sturdy. The grind is consistent and the hopper is of a pretty good size ( It handles ~20 grams of beans easily). The best part about this product is the service. The company is a small, family run shop and the experience was very personal. They sent many kind emails of instructions, tips, etc. The shipping was also very fast! I received this a day earlier than expected. Overall a great product for anyone with a passion for excellent coffee. It is definitely worth the money.

If you are looking for a grinder that provides uniform sized particles, I don't recommend this one. I have struggled to find a setting that doesn't grind against the wall of the tube and doesn't leave large gaps for bigger pieces to fall through. The burr does not stay centered and causes coffee pieces to be different sizes, which leads to coffee that is both under and over extracted. I contacted JavaPresse and they kindly sent me a new one, but I have had the same issues from the beginning.

reviews.reviewTitle: JavaPresse Manual Coffee Grinder, the one to buy
reviews.reviewText: I've used several burr grinders all electric and I would have to put this JavaPresse Manual Coffee Grinder right up there with the best. I bought two, one for my son-in-law (lives in Hungary) and one for me for when I travel. It is amazing. Simple, easy to clean and you get a clean Grind every time. You can go from coarse to extra fine. If you are looking for a manual grinder, stop and buy this one!

reviews.reviewTitle: Quiet and portable but very slow
reviews.reviewText: While I like the construction and portability of this grinder, the amount of work required for a single cup is literally exhausting. This grinder was purchased so I could grind my beans at my office for my pour-over coffee. That requires 0.9 ounces of beans in a grind size similar to raw sugar. In practice it took me 4.5 minutes of patient grinding to achieve that. I am simply unwilling to go to that trouble 4-5 times per day. On the upside I would have forearms like Popeye if I chose to keep it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Who has this kind of time?
reviews.reviewText:
It. Takes. Forever.
It's like mowing the lawn with a cuticle scissors...
Takes way too much time and too much elbow grease for too little result.
It was cute the first time I tried it and quickly lost its appeal.
You have to crank the thing for ten minutes to get a couple tablespoons of coffee.
There's a reason coffee grinders are usually electric...
No. Just - no.

Excellent product, appears to be very well made especially for the price. It took me slightly longer than expected to grind enough beans for a cup of coffee (maybe 3 minutes or so) but I'll probably get faster as I use it more. The results were fantastic! Great that you can adjust the setting to exactly what you want. It is so much better than my electric one and it's nice and quiet so I don't disturb anyone if I'm up early making coffee!

I have always heard the best way to make coffee is with fresh coffee beans a french press and a hand grinder with a burr stone in it. I heard a lot of good things about JavaPresse burr grinder and decided to give it a try. Since i care about how amazing my coffee taste i pulled the triger and bought the grinder. I definitely do not regret buying one. Amazing product. Built very well of stainless steal and the best part the burr stone. Customer service is amazing and the product is outstanding. As a matter of fact i bought 2. Keep up the good work.

I purchased this to use with a recently purchased Espro coffee press. At first I was grinding the coffee beans too coarse and the coffee came out too tasting weak and was very light color after using the coffee press. After I adjusted the grinder so the coffee grounds come out smaller, the coffee came out tasting great. I am trying to transition to a coffee press instead of the Keurig because I want better tasting coffee. This coffee grinder works great and there are many instructional videos that helped me learn what to do and how to assemble and disassemble and clean it. The only other coffee grinder I've owned was an electric small Cuisinart.

reviews.reviewTitle: A must for people that love coffee
reviews.reviewText: Bought this to use with my aero press. This has not disappointed. Very easy to use and clean and provided consistent grind once I found the consistency I wanted. Very easy to travel with.

I've been using this coffee grinder for just under a month now. I love its simple, yet very effective design. It is very easy to adjust the grind settings. Disassembly and clean up is a breeze. It's made of good quality stainless steel, yet it's compact and easily portable. It is a #1 best seller for a very good reason. There is also excellent product support from JavaPresse, should you need it.

Excellent grinder. My only complaint is that the grind storage is too small. I routinely make a 1 liter pot of French press brew and I need to empty the collection container or not use it altogether in order to grind enough.

This is what I was looking for. It requires a little bit of work, but not too bad. I will admit that sometimes I'm lazy, and end up using my already grinded coffee...
The smell of fresh coffee is amazing, and the taste is great.

This thing is as great as the reviews proclaim. In a few minutes you can grind enough beans for two cups of coffee. I use an aero press and by the time the water in my electric kettle is done boiling I am done grinding the beans. It does a great job and the grind is adjustable. Small and compact for travel and camping.

So I have actually never written a review for a product before, but decided to change that for this exact scenario... I have had this grinder for about 9 months now and use it around 5 times a week for 9 months, and this morning I actually broke the knob off of the grinder, I guess I'm too excited to drink coffee or something. Well I immediately contacted JavaPresse to see if there was anything they could do, because I vaguely remembered reading a review that said their customer service was fantastic. Anyways, I just heard back from them and they are sending me a brand new unit, on a rush shipping! I think the product itself is great, but I really think it's worth it because of the customer service.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great little burr grinder for the price.
reviews.reviewText: This manual coffee burr grinder was exactly what I needed. It will grind enough beans to fill my refillable K cup filter easily. It's fairly compact, straightforward and easy to use, looks nice and I see no reason why this wouldn't keep working for years without an issue.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect for course grinding beans for a french press.
reviews.reviewText: The JavaPresse Manual Coffee Grinder, Conical Burr Mill, Brushed Stainless Steel is Perfect for course grinding beans for a french press. Delivered on time, in perfect condition. Directions are decent and understandable. A+++++

reviews.reviewTitle: it does taste better when coffee is ground right before brewing
reviews.reviewText: It takes forever to grind a little bit of coffee. And I can't figure out how much to turn it to determine the grind size. A bit of guessing going on here. However despite those issues, it does taste better when coffee is ground right before brewing. If you don't mind a workout get this, if you want fast ground coffee go electric grinder.

If you're planning on brewing one cup of coffee this grinder is great! It does take a little while if you have to grind enough for a whole pot. It works well though, I love that it has different settings. It's small and easy to store.

Great little grinder. Love how it works, especially that it provides the superb smell of freshly ground beans without electricity! But the handle on mine tends to pop off one or more times during a 60 to 90 second grind. IMHO, this wouldn't happen if the hex rod was just a bit longer--maybe by 1/4 inch.

reviews.reviewTitle: I absolutely love the JavaPresse Manual Coffee Grinder
reviews.reviewText:
I haven't experienced any other manual coffee grinders, so going into this review I have no other comparisons. With that being said, I absolutely love the JavaPresse Manual Coffee Grinder. So far I can tell that it's durable (from the two weeks that I've had it) and the functionality of it is perfect.

With a simple twist I can do everything from coarse grinds for my French Press - to a more fine grind for my Moka Pot. Maybe it's the fact that I just feel "cool" hand-grinding my coffee beans, but I really can tell the difference in the flavor that you get compared to the electric grinder that I had for years. It's simple to take apart and clean, and it looks great on the counter, or it's small enough to store almost anywhere.

I would highly recommend this Grinder to anyone that wants a reasonably priced and extremely functional grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: I was very happy with this grinder but now after using it for ...
reviews.reviewText:
Initially, I was very happy with this grinder but now after using it for several months I have a few issues. First, the knob that sticks out the top (onto which the handle goes to turn the grinder) is too short, resulting in the handle flying off the knob when one is grinding, very annoying. Second, the aluminum lid on top gets loose after repeated use and when the handle flies off the knob while grinding, the lid will fly off as well and the coffee beans scatter everywhere. To compensate, I have to use duct tape to keep the lid on, not an attractive solution.

Sorry, I won't buy another one when this one wears out but at least I know now what issues to be aware of for my next purchase. Thank you.
I'm new to the manual grinder game but this one makes it easy. I've been able to make a great cup or pot of coffee with ease. Definitely a great tool in the arsenal in my book.

I've had this grinder for a few months now. Its ok for pour over grinds but it is really inconsistent when it comes to French press or espresso grinds. Not to mention how long it take to grind the beans, but that's what you expect with a Manuel grinder.

This is the second of these manual coffee grinders that I have purchased as family members love it and want one for themselves.
A great alternative to the electric grinders; quite sturdy and easy to travel with if you want to grind your own on the road. Customer service from the company was tremendous too!

This is way smaller than I had thought and takes too long to grind coffee. I timed myself, using their technique "hack" and it took 50 seconds to grind on tbsp of beans. It is too slow to be realistic for making anything more than a couple of cups. It is however well made and the coffee tastes great compared to my old blade grinder which also produced coffee that would wreck my stomach. I may return this item and get a larger, electric Burr grinder instead.

reviews.reviewTitle: Most reviews on here started how easy it was to use and it truly is
reviews.reviewText: So far I haven't had any issues with this grinder. Most reviews on here started how easy it was to use and it truly is. Item arrived on time and ready to use out the box. I love being able to grind my coffee beans fresh without having to dish out $100+ on an electrical burr grinder. This would be great for me cause I travel alot and usually bring my French press and try locally roasted coffee wherever I go. It's small enough to fit in a back pack or even on my small kitchen counter.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good hand operated grinder and customer service was quick to respond/handle a warranty replacement.
reviews.reviewText:
Used one for about a year, internal components ended up falling apart and some stuff got lost. I contacted and received the notification for a new one incoming. It is not in yet as of this review but 5 stars because when working it was good and for the fast warranty response.

My use was only used to coarse grind for cold brew purposes and it served me well.

Nicely designed item. I do love it. Seller very involved and reachable. It does take a while to grind enough beans for a french press. But I enjoy walking around using both arms in movement like on the video. GREAT to grind the beans AS needed with no morning appliance noise!

We love our new coffee grinder! We recently started preparing our own coffee at home. We bought organic coffee beans but we were missing another essential component: coffee grinder. After reading the components and positive reviews, we bought one from the JavaPresse company. The package was well wrapped, the item was just as described. Once opened, we read the instructions for proper usage. In addition, we received a personalized email from Irene a customer support specialist thanking us for supporting a family owned business. Irene included all the information in case of an issue that may arise with the product. For the past week coffee has been our evening ritual, no complaints it all!

reviews.reviewTitle: Finally can enjoy fresh brewed coffee at anytime
reviews.reviewText: Enjoying coffee with my pour over coffee maker as I write this. Been using for over a month and haven't had issues like some mentioned of the grinder breaking in the reviews. Recommend reading the instructions - set own grind level, turn in the ONE direction specified and Enjoy!

reviews.reviewTitle: One hand grinder + cordless drill = big savings.
reviews.reviewText: Wanna get a $300 grinder out of this $18 hand crank? Just hook your cordless drill up to it. And you will have all of your grinds in the matter of a minute or two! Awesome find and great buy!
Editing my review because the plastic part of the handle snapped off, making the entire product useless. This grinder worked well until now so I am very disappointed. Poor design.
It works well and enables great control over grind size. I've found that for a 12 cup brewer, I fill the chamber with bean almost to the top to get a nice strong brew.

This is super easy to use, very small so you can bring with you on camping trips. But if you want to grind up alot of coffee at once, or you like your coffee grounds more on the finer side, this isnt for you.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is the hand grinder to buy!
reviews.reviewText: I just got my javapresse hand grinder in the mail and my buddy and I went to work testing grinds and consistency. I'm happy to say this was a great purchase! You can't get mad that grinding by hand takes work! That's known when you buy a hand grinder. But if you want something compact consistent for small quantities but quality grinds this is the grinder you purchase. Even if something malfunctions I will buy this again or replacement parts. Well worth the money.

Thank you Irene for the great service and thank you for this great product. Prior to this purchase I would use my Vitamix dry blade container to grind my Bulletproof coffee beans, but I wanted freshly ground at time of brewing without the extra work. This solved it for me and works perfectly. Adjustable grind so that I can make fine or coarse. Once again great product and great service from Irene!

reviews.reviewTitle: I've really loved this burr grinder so far
reviews.reviewText: I've really loved this burr grinder so far. I used a friend's burr grinder for a while and decided to go with this one for two reasons: 1) This will fit perfectly inside of the open space of an aeropress, which makes them perfect companions for a traveling-coffee-set-up. 2) The reviews pointed out how on the ball JavaPresse is about customer service, and they were right! Very happy with my grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very nice grinder but extra work if you want a French Press cup of coffee... read on.
reviews.reviewText:
3/12/2017: I originally gave this grinder 4 stars. I have reduced it to 3 based on current usage. I have been using this grinder for french press coffee and after sifting the grounds i have been able to get a pretty decent cup of coffee. I have been ok with this result even when i was losing about 20% of my ground coffee. It was worth it to get that perfect cup. I recently bought a hario v60 and based on other reviews, this grinder is supposed to work better with finer grinds. I used 4 clicks from all the way to the right just where the burs start turning (as soon as the burs can turn, that's my first click). At 4 clicks, I aim to have a salt like texture. I tried this, and for the specific recipe i was using, it the draw time was double the time i expected. Coffee was really bitter. I tried 6 clicks. Coffee was better but still a bit bitter. 6 is a bit too much though.. I use 10 clicks for my french press.

Today I did a test to see how inconsistent the grind was and maybe if I sifted, i could improve my coffee taste. I figured, if i lost 20% of my ground coffee, it would be acceptable as it already was with my french press. The sifter I use is a tea infuser... it's a metal mesh and it works great. It passes everything except salt size particles. What's sifted feels really powdery. It was a bit disappointing to see that only 40% of my coffee was left after sifting. Losing 60% of my ground coffee is not acceptable.I either got a bad unit, or I am really picky about how my coffee tastes. Refer to the pictures.

I took the grinder apart and noticed a lot of wobble and sometimes you can see the center cone is off center. I noticed that there may be a little part missing which I have emailed Java Presse about. The first time they responded, and sent a replacement grinder which I really appreciated and think it makes them a great company to work with. However, the replacement suffered from what i think it's a missing part. I emailed them about that and got no response. I'll keep testing the grinder a bit more and I will report on my progress.

2/5/2017: I have had this manual grinder for a couple weeks now and I have been debating whether or not to write a review. There are a lot of things that I like about this grinder and a few things I don't which is why I just gave it 4 stars and not 5. However, after much reading about other grinders I am not sure if 4 stars is a fair rating and maybe I should give it a 5.

First, I am not an expert on manual grinders or grinders at all for that matter. Prior to getting this grinder I had a blade grinder which I only had for a couple of weeks and probably used twice. I am not a big coffee drinker and I come from an instant coffee world... a few weeks back my wife asked me to get her some coffee which she really likes... so after reading I found out that the best coffee comes from grinding your own beans. I immediately started reading more and somehow I ended up buying the blade grinder... then I read some more and read that a drip coffee machine wouldn't cut it for the best coffee so I settled down with a French Press. I tried the blade grinder for a couple of times but the coffee was a bit inconsistent... after more reading I needed a burr grinder. After much research and since I was on a budget I decided to get this grinder. So the main reason to get this grinder was for my french press. I read a few reviews that this grinder was really good for a French Press.

So, after testing this grinder with my French Press I have the following likes and dislikes:

Likes:

1. Since I use it for French Press, the grinding time is not too long for about 30 grams of coffee. 30 grams even though I fill up the reservoir all the way to the top.
2. The ground coffee seems very consistent from grind to grind, although not very consistent grinds (explained later as part of my dislikes)
3. When I receive the product, I immediately got a lot of support either from the documentation in the packaging and links to videos on how to set it up, the different grinds, how to clean, disassemble and put it back together. I really liked this because you can immediately tell that the owners have put some thought into the product and their customers.
4. The finish of the product is outstanding and it looks like it's going to last a long time.

Dislikes:

1. Even though I can repeat the grinds from grind to grind... a single grind contains a lot of different size pieces, and even a lot of fines...Even though i dislike this from this product, I have read that even more expensive bur grinder suffer from the same issue... Unless I get a commercial bur grinder I may always have this problem with coarse grinds like the French Press. Initially I would grind at its coarsest setting of 18 clicks and then sieve the grinds with a regular household sieve (plastic) and it would remove about 14% of my ground coffee. The coffee was good. After reading some, I decided to grind at 15 clicks and sieve again... this time I ended up removing up to 25% of my ground coffee... this is why a full reservoir of coffee grounds only yielded 30 grams of coffee. The cup of coffee that I got though was the best cup of coffee I've gotten out all my entire setup (fresh coffee, just a few days from roast, french press, kettle with thermometer).
2. I don't like that i have to sieve my coffee, but I've read that even the more expensive burr grinders suffer from this problem... so I don't know if I should fault this grinder for this or not. However, the reason why I gave the 4 stars instead of the 5 stars is because I think this problem could have been minimized if the burr mechanism would be a bit more steady... I have noticed that it wobbles a bit which is why I think why there are so many smaller grinds... maybe for the next generation some kind of fastener from the screw to the bottom of where the ground coffee goes could solve this issue.

Again, I am not an expert but I am very picky with the stuff I buy. Overall, I really like this manual grinder... and if in the future I buy another one, I may add a comparison review.

reviews.reviewTitle: Stay away if espresso quality is desired
reviews.reviewText:
Im over here trying to get quality shots at 9bar. Out of the box it worked fine and gave me the fineness I needed. Over time, Ive had to repeatedly tighten the adjustment nut as if the burrs are contacting each other and dulling themselves. Its lasted me two months doing about one shot a day (18g) but it has finally been rendered useless because I cant tighten the burrs anymore and the shot sprays out of my naked portafilter all over the counter due to coarseness and unevenness. Serious espresso lovers beware!

(grinder is probably fine for pourover snobs)

Great product. Arrived very quickly. Best of all is the support from the company. Not that I had a problem with it, but if I did I imagine they would be extremely helpful. I received several follow up emails ensuring I was happy and satisfied with the grinder. They also sent me a series of three emails that explained tips and tricks on how to use the grinder as well as the company's philosophy. One email even includes advise on starting a morning routine and how to incorporate coffee into that routine and bring more mindfulness into your day. Overall a very unique company that truly seems to care about their customers and sharing knowledge with them and bringing happiness to the world with coffee.

EDIT: I contacted JavaPresse and they generously sent me a replacement free of charge! The new grinder works amazingly well and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a manual coffee grinder.

This thing keeps getting stuck. I've filled the hopper with beans, but when I'm turning the handle clockwise it just doesn't grind anything. At best, it's taking me 20 minutes just to grind one load of beans. Such a waste of my time... It's great when it actually decides to grind.

reviews.reviewTitle: Makes it fun to make coffee
reviews.reviewText: I recently changed coffeemakers to a Chemex and wanted to hand grind my beans just to try out. Whether I have made 1 cup or 5, it's a nice break for a few minutes to easily grind away. It only takes about 5 minutes to hand grind enough for a full 10-cup Chemex and and the work put into makes it taste a little better. Stays clean with a quick wipe down afterwards and the design looks great put out as a decoration when not in use.
Sturdy and well made item. Lots of videos and instructions on how to use grinder. Several emails before and after receiving item to follow up with purchase. High quality!

reviews.reviewTitle: Quuick and easy to understand and use
reviews.reviewText: When you have quality coffee to grind and you don't want to break out a big burr grinder for just a cup or two, this is the perfect solution! Great purchase, very pleased with it.

So far so good. It grinds coffee as was intended, is portable enough to take on trips, and definitely works to get better grinds than cheap electric ones that pretty much pulverize the grounds into dust. Great addition for anyone who travels or doesn't want to spend a fortune on a fancy electric machine like some coffee shops use.

This may seem like it won't make a significant difference in your coffee making, but it really can, especially with a French press. This is a simple, but well made product for a reasonable price. It's simple enough to use, although loading the chamber with coffee beans is a little awkward. It is helpful to use a funnel or something similar.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for Making Two Cups of Coffee
reviews.reviewText: I wouldn't use this manual grinder for grinding a lot of beans, but I use it every day to make about four great cups of coffee each day. I take it with me when I travel.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product supported with exceptional customer service
reviews.reviewText: I used my Javapresse for the first time this morning. I followed instructions to get the right grind and it was great. I use the Hario V60 dripper with the Hario filters and with the freshly-ground beans, it was perfect. Like other reviewers, I have to mention the excellent customer service. Jacque responded to my email quickly and resolved the problem in no time. I recommend the product for a perfect coffee experience.

Its small, but good things come in small packages, I used it today, made a great cup of coffee, had a electric grinder before,, when I used it on coffee beans, they always came out as bad, not really bad, but rather bold in taste, I assume from the heat of the blades breaking up the beans, but this is so much better, its the best. Its a slow grind, can be used when the electric is off in the house.

The extra long tube shape is difficult to scoop beans into without a spill.
The grinder just rests atop the catch. This makes grinding beans difficult as I have to hold both surfaces to get while grinding.
The elongated knob/turner is uncomfortable. It's also likely to pop off during use.

It would probably make better use as a pepper grinder, unfortunately I want coffee. Maybe I should just grind the beans over the filter. ????

reviews.reviewTitle: Not durable enough for daily grinding
reviews.reviewText: Handle screw that holds knob on broke in two after one week od daily grinds. Need new crank. I think it will be too much work to gring expresdo every dsy. Looks very nice but may not be durable.

Love my coffee grinder so far. It works just as expected and the company has had great customer service so far. I especially like the adjuster on the bottom and being able to get the grind just exactly how I want it. It's small and I find that if I fill the top with beans it takes about 1-2 of those to make enough for my 10 cup coffee maker. I was worried a little reading other reviews where people said it took forever if making more than one cup but at least for me that hasn't been the case.

reviews.reviewTitle: Im a Cuban coffee addict. I love it!
reviews.reviewText: As a Cuban I take coffee very seriously. I love making coffe 100% manual. I love that I can control the thickness of the coffee with this grinder. Yes, it takes a minute (or 5 depending on the type of bean) but it is guarantied quality.

Works great and was easy to adjust to the ground size I wanted. Te grinder works great for small amounts of coffee like is used in a Moka maker or AeroPress. You do have some trial and error to get the right ground size but it is worth it. It wouldn't work well if you need to adjust the ground size for several different types coffee makers. It works best as a dedicated grinder for on size of ground. I measure the amount of beans before putting them into the grinder so I have a consistent amount ground with no waste It does take a few minutes to get the coffee ground up but that is just the nature of doing it by hand. This replaced a electric grinder that final wore out. This grinder is very compact and will go in our camper or on kayak trips for some great fresh ground coffee.
I tried the coffee grinder as soon as it arrived. The instructions for the settings were easily understood and the beans that I tested worked exactly as I had hoped.

I purchased this a little less than a year ago for use at work. Produces a great grind and easily adjustable.

However, the handle on the unit is separate from the grinder and sits on a pentagonal metal peg. After using this almost daily the handle's peg has worn down to the point where the handle slips while grinding. This has made the grinder nearly unusable and I will need to purchase another.

Very diappointed in this. I ordered this to have in a second house we use. I did not expect it to take so long to grind beans for a pot of coffee. So long that it isn't worth it. Missed the return window but will definitely be getting an electric burr grinder.

Have been using this for about 3 months now and the grind size has become really inconsistent. As far as more coarse grinds like drip coffee/french press it's fine but I've been using it for espresso and the grind is getting larger and larger to the point where I can't even make espresso anymore. The grind size is too large and it comes out watery.

We finally figured out how to get the grind how we wanted it. We really didnt feel like getting on the site and watching a YouTube video. The instructions didnt make sense. It didnt click the way it said.

I've been using this grinder daily for the past week and has been performing great. Grind has always come out consistent, takes little effort to use and has become apart of my morning ritual. The main reason I went with this grinder was the fact I often make a cup while relaxing after work and my wife and son are usually asleep. I didn't want to disturb them with an electric grinder. This one was also very cost friendly for the results I've had so far would definitely recommend to others.

reviews.reviewTitle: Small and compact, easily fits in your suitcase. Never drink bad hotel coffee again!
reviews.reviewText: Because this coffee grinder is so compact, Iwas able to put it in my briefcase and grind at work. It is so quiet, no one around me was distrubed as I ground up some coffee for my french press.

reviews.reviewTitle: It ground the beans after a lengthy and annoying amount of turning the crank that tempted and has ...
reviews.reviewText:
It gets 2 stars because it ground the beans. It ground the beans after a lengthy and annoying amount of turning the crank that tempted and has convinced me to get my drill for the next time I use it.

Also there is some type of awful taste in my coffee the only difference is the grinder....

reviews.reviewTitle: is stainless steel and it looks very durable easy to carry with you.
reviews.reviewText: this grinder works great, great size and allows you to adjust how coarse or fine you like your whole coffee. it sure gives you the pleasure of drinking coffee with a great fresh taste.

Amazing. Works great. You have to adjust the screw for fineness once so often. I had a problem. Javapress replaced it for free. Loved their customer service. I am still using mine and no problem. Very happy with the purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use and great for the price!
reviews.reviewText: Been using this somewhat regularly for a year now and haven't had any issues. I don't use it every day but probably average once or twice a week. Obviously more work than an electric grinder, but significantly cheaper!

reviews.reviewTitle: Attractive product but feels flimsy and takes a while
reviews.reviewText: It's a good looking grinder, but the feel is disappointing. The lower canister that catches the grounds mates loosely with the top half. As a result I can feel the lower half bending relative to the top half as I crank, which I do no like and it's going to bother me every time I use this. I've only ever used another burr grinder before, and it not only ground faster than this one but felt more sturdy because it had a glass jar that threaded into the upper half.

reviews.reviewTitle: So far so good though. I probably don't have the absolute best ...
reviews.reviewText: I bought this because I had just gotten a French Press as part of a gift basket in a silent auction. I'm new to French Press and quickly learned I needed a different grind. This grinder had a lot of positive reviews so for the price I tried it. I mistakenly read the "15 settings" and thought it would be actual settings (I didn't look closely enough at the pictures) so I was a little surprised to find that it was a trial and error manual turn type of thing. So far so good though. I probably don't have the absolute best setting but I'm not getting anything coming through the mesh of the French Press and my coffee tastes delicious!

reviews.reviewTitle: Can grind Fine or Coarse Coffee
reviews.reviewText: I have not had the grinder long but I am ver satisfied with the functionality of the product as you can really personalize the grind to your liking. It does take a good few minutes to grind enough for 1 pot of coffee but it is not difficult and I have even had my 5 yr old son help me. The grinder is compact and fits just enough beans to grind for a 32 oz pot of coffee in 1 round.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very nice customer service. Not a good product. See review for other link.
reviews.reviewText:
I am surprised by all the positive reviews. I feel like maybe people just get excited by the "crowd influence" or something. For a grinder to cost over $20 AND require quite a bit of manual work, I would expect that the results would at least be stellar since I'm having to do all the labor. I'm not paying for the convenience, right? So I should be paying for a well-made product. That's supposed to be the trade-off. Well, my grinder arrived and I read the instructions. Tried adjusting the burr and IMMEDIATELY noticed that the burr spins on an oblong axis. I could not only hear the burr skip against itself on each revolution, but a visual inspection clearly showed the steel rod to be curved and not straight at all, which kind of defeats the purpose of the superior conical-shaped burr.

"It's ok" I told myself, "all the reviews said the customer service is excellent." And you know what? It is. Kudos to JavaPresse because they are very helpful and attentive and kind and everything I would ask for with customer care. They sent me a replacement promptly and asked me to follow up. However, the second grinder not only had the same problem, but it was even more pronounced than the original. I really mean no offense to JavaPresse because they were very kind to me, but there is a serious flaw in this product. I'm not going to exert manual labor into this process unless I'm getting a better result than the electric grinders which are only $15 more. I was hoping to get grounds quality like that of a $200+ automatic electric grinder. I returned the product and bought the next best electric conical burr grinder I could:Cuisinart CBM-18N Programmable Conical Burr MillYes, it's 3.5 times more, but for the convenience, and not to mention SUPERIOR results that I get with the STEEL burrs and consistent settings, I am so much happier to invest in this than to twist away with the JavaPresse. Yes, $80 was hard to swallow, but it's Cuisinart and I think it will be a good investment.

Good enough consistency for travel. Wouldn't use it every day unless this was all I could afford.

Takes 1:20 to grind 20g at setting 12.

Warning. The one I got from Amazon was unable to grind to any consistency and didn't have "notches" in the settings knob. I emailed JavaPresse and they sent me a new grinder, which worked much better.

reviews.reviewTitle: it does take effort and about 5 minutes to grind ...
reviews.reviewText: it does take effort and about 5 minutes to grind about 21 grams for a chemex pourover. Worth it, though.
It broke after a few uses

Does it taste better just because of the added work you did to manual grind the beans? It's possible, but I think the grinding creates a better taste that the chopping of the cheap electric grinder. I wouldn't want to hand grind enough for a 12 cup pot, but it is perfect for a single cup.

This low cost grinder really does make a better tasting cup of coffee. I've always used an electric grinder, whether metal conical burr or blade type, then stored my ground coffee in a jar for easy use. It easily beats pre-ground and is worth the trouble. Grinding by hand right before brewing is more work but the result is even more satisfying. I highly recommend this grinder.

It takes me about 2-3 minutes to espresso grind using this grinder. If you are going to grind several cups of coffee i would not recommend, however if you grind just for yourself or for travel this is an excellent option.

This Coffee grinder is stainless steel hand held manual coffee grinder with ceramic burr.
I personally use is to grid fresh coffee bean as well as whole black pepper and kosher sea salt at times. I find it works perfectly for me in these uses and is an excellent multi use grinder for me.

Also, the company customer care is Top Notch, and they made me feel like this was more than just a purchase but also a delightful experience.

Great product. Great company.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great grinder from a great company
reviews.reviewText:
Could not be happier with the whole experience. Easy to adjust and get the coffee ground exactly the way I want it. The handle provides the correct amount of leverage to make the grinding smooth and easy without being a ridiculously large motion. Just don't grind away in the office next to your co-workers, they may be less happy with the action than you are :-).

The customer server was amazing and they were very active in making sure that I was taken care of and that the product was up to my expectations.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very easy to use. Would buy again
reviews.reviewText: Only thing I don't like is how long it takes to grind the coffee. I have never used a coffee grinder by hand and it takes longer than I thought. However, product is small, built well, and seems to grind my coffee very well. I like the feature where you can adjust how fine you would like you coffee. I would buy again and recommend to a friend.

This is a great compact manual grinder. Takes a little of bit of effort if youre grinding for more than one person. Can probably hold about 35 grams worth of beans max before you have to put more in the chamber. Also, I have a Hario V60 and the booklet recommended to set it to a medium fine grind which didnt work out for me. Its too fine and extracted the grinds. Its easy to grind with the proper motion. Be prepared that itll take a few minutes and you might break a sweat.
I do not grind a lot of coffee, but this mill works great! (I would not recommend for volume use, but great for small quantities.) Very nice looking and functions flawlessly.

reviews.reviewTitle: I liked the company representative email me and asked if I ...
reviews.reviewText: I decided to purchase this coffee grinder based on another review. I am not an "expert" in coffee by any means but I wanted to step up my game because I was getting tired of the bitterness in my coffee every time I fired up my Keurig. Also I got tired of buying coffee from the shops because I am broke yo! So I bought the Aeropress from BBB (sorry no verified purchase review) and in combination the grinder and Aeropress work miracles. I liked the company representative email me and asked if I had any questions. The only 1 complaint I have I wished they would have shipped in a box instead of a bubble envelope. Overall though great product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Grinds to the size I need for my stove pot espresso java pot ( I don't know what the correct name is but its not a real espresso maker or anything like that). Makes a better coffee in my opinion ...
reviews.reviewText: Works well and affordable. Grinds to the size I need for my stove pot espresso java pot ( I don't know what the correct name is but its not a real espresso maker or anything like that). Makes a better coffee in my opinion tried my favorite brand ground and whole bean ground with this and the whole bean ground with this was significantly better.

So far so good..l. I get fresh coffee every morning. It's a little bit of a workout grinding the beans and takes a bit longer than my keurig, but I will sometimes grind the beans before bed so it's ready to go in the morning. It really isn't too bad though....about 2-5 minutes of grinding. It's lightweight, portable, and quiet.

Love the grinder. It makes nice, uniform ground coffee. The customer service is top notch. I have had no problems, but love the fact that they reach out to you from the beginning to ensure you don't. They have made me feel like a valued customer from the get-go. They have managed to recreate the feel of buying from your neighborhood coffee shop with a purchase on Amazon..

Love this coffee grinder! Easy to assemble, and disassemble for cleaning. Works great! I would not recommend for arthritic hands. It does take some effort to use. But my phase in life is all about slowing down and enjoying the process of each moment. So a hand coffee grinder is perfect for me.

reviews.reviewTitle: If you buy this be sure you like to grind baby grind
reviews.reviewText: It's a very nice little machine but if you fill it up with beans you'll grind for a good 10 minutes to get about 2 pots worth of coffee. It's fairly quiet though, unlike the electric grinders.

The grinder is very sleek in design and is easy to use. It works well and would recommend this product. But beyond the actual product I would say the customer service is fantastic. They have reached out to me to make sure the grinder got delivered and was working properly and gave me instructions on how to use it for the first time which was helpful. Also, the email they sent me is from a person and not a norelpy email address so you can respond back. My grinder works well so I didn't need anything from them, but still decided to reply to the email as a thank you. They responded within an hour. Any place that will respond to an email, late at night and right away care about their customers.

Really pleased! I ordered a grinder because my favorite brand of coffee is sold only as whole bean. I considered an electric grinder but saw the reviews the JavaPresse got and decided to give it a try. I am lazy about reading instructions thoroughly and had no trouble getting things going. The coffee is tasty with none of the bitterness youll find in pre-ground stuff. And customer service is fantastic! They reached out before and after it arrived just to check in. That kind of service leads to repeat (and loyal) customers. Definitely recommend!

When I finally received my package containing this JavaPresse Coffee Grinder, I found the box had been torn completely open (one end of the box was floating around the package, and the rest of the box was torn from top to bottom, in a half- spiral way) with the grinder rolling around in its two layers of bubble wrap. I then pulled the grinder out of the bubble wrap, pulled the grinder's three pieces apart, and found the burr that rotates broken into two pieces. I super- glued the burr back together, and reassembled the grinder, and it works great. I've only had it for less than twenty- four hours, but I have gone through almost an entire half pound of beans. Other than the packaging mishap, the JavaPresse Manual Coffee Grinder seems to be a good, reliable product.

This is a really good grinder. No issues yet. Its portable making it easy to travel with and easy to disassemble requiring no tools. I only wish there was something on the actual device itself saying how many clicks you need to get different size grains rather than needing to look in the manual, however its not a deal breaker

Ive never ground my own coffee before so didnt know what to expect, but this compact grinder is a nice addition to my morning routine. It stores easily and doesnt require much space in my small RV coffee station.

I also appreciate the emails I received from Jacque, checking in at every step to see if I needed anything. The small company approach to customer service is refreshing.

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazing product from an Amazing company
reviews.reviewText:
This grinder works great! Easily adjustable from a very coarse grind to extremely fine for the best cup of coffee every time. I have a stovetop espresso pot and its can be hard to find the right grind. With my grinder I can dial in the perfect grind quickly and super easily. And there is nothing like a shot of espresso from fresh ground beans.
I am a barista by profession, and I have some friends who would love a good manual coffee grinder. I will definitely be purchasing a few more of these as gifts in the future. Perfect for someone who camp's alot and for the coffee connoisseur.
The customer service is amazing also. They responded within minutes usually, and were extremely compassionate.

I'm so glad about this grindr. I've been making French press everyday for a long time and always trying to find how to make it fresh and delicious as can be. Using this hand grinder improved the freshness by a hundred. This is a very fine quality product. Easy to use and clean. The people who make have all sorts of YouTube videos to teach you everything, how to adjust grind, how to clean, how to take it all apart and hen put it back together again. I'm glad also because I am travelling and staying in hotel rooms a lot, and this product is small and durable and it's pretty easy to turn the crank so I'm pretty sure I won't mind using it every single day to get the freshest coffee. That's all, thanks guys for the quality grinder

reviews.reviewTitle: UPDATE: Doesn't wake my wife - Burr grinder works great, it is quiet and not difficult to turn the crank. I recommend it
reviews.reviewText: Fantastic Burr Grinder! Works great! It is not too noisy for other people in my office. It is not difficult to turn the crank. I love it and recommend it. I bought a second one for home, to use in the morning so I don't wake my wife with my electric burr grinder.

This is an updated review based on the JavaPresse Manual Coffee Grinder's new and improved burr. I love this grinder and use it just about every morning. Thanks to the new burr it is now durable, easy to use, and grinds coffee beans just how you like them!

I am highly satisfied and pleased with my JavaPresse coffee grinder. It arrived well protected in its packaging, is very lightweight, but very sturdy. I would not hesitate to put this in a backpack and travel with it.
The grind is consistant and works well with my espresso machine and my french press. I highly recommend this product.

Manual coffee grining is an acquired taste (effort). But...for my 1 cup at a time Aeropress or pour overs its perfect.
Very uniform grind results. Adjustment is quite easy.
Most importantly customer service is AMAZING!!! Had an issue with the 1st one shipped. They shot out a new one right away, told me just keep the old one.
Would buy again.

We love our JavaPresse Manual Coffee Grinder! It performs better than we expected. It is convenient to use, well designed, portable, and built to last. The JavaPresse Coffee Company assigned a Customer Support Specialist who has reached out to us and has provided a pdf instruction manual in case we lost the hard copy manual. That's great customer service!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for one person, not two.
reviews.reviewText: Great grinder - it's definitely solid for one cup drinkers but if you're making coffee for two people in a traditional 34 oz press, you'll soon be just living with the electric grinder you already had instead of grinding beans for 6 minutes by hand. Also, they bombard you with e-mails once you've bought this thing. I've gotten at least 6 or 7 e-mails. It's fine, they're passionate and that's great. But it's a just a coffee grinder!

Reviews during the honeymoon phase of a new purchase are tricky, but so far my new grinder has treated me exceptionally well. I can tell that the crew at JavaPresse is very keen on making sure their product arrives in good condition and works as intended. It's quiet, almost therapeutic to use, and piques peoples' interest. Cubicle or camping, I think I made the right choice.

This and aAeropress Coffee and Espresso Makerwill run you a bit over $50, one sleeves into the other perfectly, and you have basically everything you need to say good riddance to what passes for coffee in most office environments without succumbing to a $20 a week Starbucks habit. Life's short, so why not brew your own rather than stand in line?

I use this manual grinder to make single-serving batches of pour-over and cold brew coffee. It's relatively quick to grind out what I need, and the grind size is both adjustable and nicely consistent. All in all an excellent way to get a quality burr grinder without shelling out for an electric one. It's portability is just an extra plus.

I guess you get what you pay for - it is difficult to determine what position to turn the knob to get the right size of ground coffee. In addition, you have to turn the crank several times for a cup's worth of ground coffee. However, after some trial and error, it does work okay to give you quality coffee.
This grinder is well made and easy to adjust. I works great for a single cup of coffee. If you are making more than that it takes to much time and effort. I also bought an electric for that reason.

I ordered this magnificent coffee grinder just after Christmas. I received it on New Year's Day. So, after about five uses the knob broke on the handle. It was still usable but the knob kept coming off. Well I emailed their customer service on New Year's Eve and they replied within half an hour at 9:30 at night. They informed me that they we extremely sorry and we're sending a whole new unit to me. All I needed was a handle and they sent me a new grinder! That is phenomenal customer service. I'm thoroughly pleased and the grinder makes outstanding coffee. I use it for my Aeropress and the flavor is outstanding with the grind remaining consistent. The grinder is fast and easy to adjust from course to fine with their click system. Finally it is easy to maintain and take apart.

Super quick delivery. The grinder is cute, easy to use, and perfect grind for my morning French press. I haven't yet tried a very fine grind for my moka, but that'll happen soon enough. Intuitive to use. I'm thinking about sewing a travel pouch for it, so I don't lose the handle. The website is great; useful to learn how to take it apart for cleaning.

This grinder is an excellent example of quality materials and manufacturing. The grind handle is the right size to create the leverage to easily grind coffee beans. The adjustable grind easily allows grinds from almost coarse to espresso. I always make a single cup of strong coffee and the hoper holds more than enough beans for my purposes. Instructions are pretty good and youtube videos are great. Customer service is soo good!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Functional for traveling but certainly not good quality of coffee grinding.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this product thinking that it will grind my good quality coffee beans to a consist size, however, what I found is a grind that is not consist at all. When I grind a small portion (~20 gm) of coffee beans to medium fine grind, to use it for Aeropress or V60, I usually find large grounded pieces and somewhat fine coffee. Also, the process of grinding that small portion is very tiresome and takes a long time, because you can't speed up the rotation otherwise the coffee beans will keep jumping inside. I liked the quality of material used (stainless steel), and it's perfect size for traveling with Aeropress. But honestly, I wish that I went with more respected and known brand like Hario.

reviews.reviewTitle: Haste makes waste, JavaPresse is the best!
reviews.reviewText: I was skeptical that such a simple device--well-made--could perform the grind operation as stated. My confidence and appreciation for this fine tool is based on one premise: any hand tool requires close attention to the skills in using it. Read the directions! Although I produced a perfect grind with my first attempt, others in my family did not...they didn't read, or ask how to use it. With care, cleaning and a conscious understanding of how this tool works, you'll enjoy Barista quality coffee in the comfort of your own kitchen!

This grinder makes all the difference in coffee enjoyment. Makes the coffee so smooth and non-acidic. It is manual so you have to work a little to grind the beans but it is totally worth it and you will love how your arms will get toned in the process of making your coffee!

reviews.reviewTitle: Uneven grind after a few months
reviews.reviewText:
I specifically bought this coffee grinder so I could grind my beans for my french press.
Beware: the grind size becomes noticeably inconsistent over time. I used it for about 2 months, about 2 to 3 times a week. I washed the grinder and reassembled it twice per their youtube videos during that time period when I noticed the grind becoming uneven - with the size ranging from very coarse (about a quarter of a coffee bean half) to a medium coarse grind.
I reached out to their customer support a month ago, but haven't heard back yet. If you care about grind consistency, I cannot recommend this grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Super handy. Well-made. Not ideal for fine grinds.
reviews.reviewText: Grinding my beans by hand has become part of my morning ritual. But I should warn that the grind settings are more art than science; you have to tinker with the dial to find the grind that suits you best (there are no presets for coarse, fine, etc.) I typically run my beans through once, then run the coarse grounds through one more time.

reviews.reviewTitle: The JavaPresse grinder is easy to use and is very well-made
reviews.reviewText: Our coffee maker with a built-in blade grinder stopped working, so we were in the market for a new maker and a new grinder. The JavaPresse grinder is easy to use and is very well-made. The parts have a very snug fitby the second or third use the hopper came apart from the main unit very easily, but only when I was ready to take it off. We have been experimenting with the coarseness setting to find the best tasting brew, mostly because that adjustment is so easy to make on the grinder. Raj's videos on various aspects of the grinder and its use were super helpful. I haven't needed to contact the JavaPresse Coffee Company for any reason, but they have made very clear that they're ready to help if I have any issues.

reviews.reviewTitle: Adjustment mechanism does not work and grind is huge.
reviews.reviewText: I am so disappointed! I was very excited about this purchase and using it . I bought favorite beans, read the instructions and couldnt drink the cup I brewed. I adjusted, brewed, discarded and read again. Bottom line is that the grind adjustment does not work. The pieces I am using are on average a quarter inch chunks. The coffee is so weak that I can read through the French press beaker. There is no more adjustment to make. I think the unit is defective.
Bought it for my 17 year old coffee lover because his other one was so loud! This is perfect for college and roommates. Quiet and easy to use and clean. Also makes delicious coffee!
Been using for a while, produces great coffee for espresso. As stated by the company, if you have a large amount of coffee to grind, you probably want a larger grinder.

A friend had given me a bag of whole bean coffee...I decided to get a small hand crank coffee grinder. This one is a sweet little tool that works so well. It's very easy to use. I had quickly ground enough for my percolator pot. I can now buy my coffee as whole bean and grind as needed - making a fabulous pot of coffee!

Honestly a good piece to have if you would rather buy the beans instead of the coffee grounds.
It does the job and the directions are easy to follow. Only "issue" if I could even call it that, is the cleaning.
Even then, cleaning is pretty simple if you use your imagination a bit. I clean everything with water except the grinding portion of it. I just use a compressed can of air to blow out the particle of coffee beans and it's good as new. Easy peezy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fantastic grinder and even more EXCELLENT customer service!
reviews.reviewText: This grinder is AMAZING!!! Its portable and adjustable to the perfect grind! You can take it anywhere and grind coffee without electricity, it is perfect! The other great thing about this grinder is the company that sells it. They are a private family owned company with EXCELLENT customer service! I had my grinder for a year when a small part of it broke and I reached out via email to the company and they got back to me within two hours and fixed my problems immediately so friendly and kind! I highly recommend buying this grinder not only because it is an excellent grinder but also because the customer service is so amazing! Thanks JavaPresse!

This is going to sound nutty, but I look forward to getting up in the morning to grind coffee. I know, get a life. One full canister is good for four cups in my Farberware Yosemite stovetop percolator. Not a fan of the electrics, because I like strong coffee, and most of them have automatic shutoffs. I can keep the stovetop going for a few extra minutes. Anyway, the JP is working great. Only thing I can't figure out? Why would I ever have to clean this thing?

reviews.reviewTitle: The grinder is great, but the customer service is better!
reviews.reviewText: The grinder does its job and gives me a fantastic even coarse grind for my cold brew needs. What really makes this particular product go above and beyond is the customer service. JavaPresse really goes out of their way to make sure you have a good grasp on how to use the product to its maximum potential. This grinder is a great entry into the "fancy coffee" life because it's easy to use and because the company is right there to help.
I'd say this is an OK product, although small. It is difficult to keep the turning handle attached and the design makes it top heavy and prone to taking over. It works, but it's not anything special.

So far the grinder has been great. There is a bit of a learning curve with the clicks and settings for grind type but its not a big curve by any means! Customer service has been top notch as well. I highly recommend this grinder.

This product is okay for its price. The grinds are a little bit inconsistent, but not a huge deal. The biggest issue is that the container where the coffee grounds fall simply slides onto the piece containing the burr/hand crank. It's not very secure. When you're grinding coffee, you actually have to hold these two pieces together with your hand, which is a bit tiring. I am possibly considering returning this grinder for that reason ...

Great manual grinder with a consistent grind. I was talking to a friend and he mentioned that he had a manual grinder and I told him that I had just gotten one as well. I joking said "did you get the JavaPresse?", and he said "Yes, it's the best!". My only issue is that I wish that there was a fixed handle option with this grinder but it isn't a huge issue. It also took a little bit to find the right grind for our pour over. It does comes with an instruction manual that describes the grind nicely, pictures would be nice. Overall, I would highly recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use. Fresh ground coffee is way better IMO.
reviews.reviewText: Easy to use. Fresh ground coffee is way better IMO. I don't like how much the company tries to initiate you into their product lines but I can respect that they do it and they kind of need it so I ignore it. Might not bother other people.

This perfectly crafted little device, bought on whimsy, has become my husband's favorite Christmas gift. He found the grinder simple to assemble and use, and the guide for grind sizes to be the clearest explanation to date, with pictures. While our morning coffee was always above average  we are lucky enough to have an excellent micro-roaster up the street  the same coffee beans prepared from this little grinder makes a noticeably better cup of coffee. The device is slender and attractive, and easily fits into the kitchen cupboard of our small city apartment. I bought the reccommended "upgraded ceramic burr" at the same time, but needn't have; ours came with the same ceramic burr. Well worth the money.

Ok, this is my first coffee grinder. So far, I love it!!! We don't make a ton of coffee in our house. This size was perfect for us. I bought this to make grounds for our Keurig. It saves me a lot of money not having to buy kcups. It's better for the environment and best of all, the coffee is BETTER!
Your grinder is perfect for me.I make a pour over coffee and the grind is just right.I also live where the power goes off a lot so your product allows me to make my coffee even then!Thanks
Works great for a cup or 2 of coffee. Perfect grind. I use this constantly when going to work and dont want to wake everyone with my noisy electric grinder.

I have this product 5 stars because you can gring a wonderful cup of coffee with it! That being said I had to use two pair of pliers to get the bottom separated from the top!! I was almost to the point of sending it back when I used the pliers. I think a better way to ship the grinder is in pieces or with tissue paper between the removable parts.

The attached instructions on how to grind are misleading. It is only in the last step that I learned not to grind counterclockwise to obtain a rough grind. It is the bottom clog that gets turned to set the grind size, not the handle - despite the picture of the handle in the instructions. It was only when I went to the web page demo that I realized the difference and assume I didn't destroy the mechanism by turning the handle incorrectly. All of this BEFORE consuming my morning coffee.

I got this grinder because I was tired of the large containers of coffee in the office going stale and having to drink the stuff because it's what we had available.
