This grinder is great holds enough coffee for 2 people to use in those popular kcup reusable filters. I've also used the grinds in a percolator, the size range is great. The grinding is easy and size is consistent. I have noticed however if you go too fast when grinding the size may be slightly larger than if you slow down a bit. Over all satisfied with my purchase others in the office asked where I got it from and I have directed them here. I will probably be picking up another here shortly to keep at home.

I love this coffee grinder. I had a manual grinder many years ago and it was slow and took quite and effort to use. The JavaPresse is great. It grinds easily. it grinds consistently. It's small and easy to hold. And it works quickly. In a few minutes I have enough beans ground to make my morning pot of coffee without losing any counter space. You could travel with it and always have freshly ground coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: When it was working I really liked it.
reviews.reviewText:
Purchased this grinder less than 9 months ago. And even without using it everyday I had the same experience of the plastic disc on the bottom of the grind mechanism cracking and falling apart. Grinder is now trash...won't turn at all. When it was working I really liked it...but if you're going to make a quality product then you must make all of it the right way with no shortcuts.

Update. 9/25/17
Customer Service rep from company contacted me and sent me a replacement. So far so good. Happy to find the company stands behind their product and does whatever it takes to make it right with the customer. Thank you.

I recently realized that I would not be able to make coffee in a power failure, so I decided to try this manual grinder. I have so far just used it at a coarse setting for cold brew. It is easy and quick to use, and I recommend it!

It works. To grind the beans necessary to for 16oz of brewed coffee you will crank for about 5 minutes (or 1.5 pop songs). It's up to you whether you want to. The hand holding the grinder gets a bit tired as its made of slick metal and you also have to hold it in such a way that the bottom doesn't fall off.

But it works. And it's not a blade, so the grind it's relatively consistent.

reviews.reviewTitle: Just Think. You can grind coffee during power outages!
reviews.reviewText: If youre patient and like a little morning exercise, this grinder is for you! I wish it didnt require 500 crank turns for 3-4 tablespoons of ground coffee, but it sure tastes good. Grinding seems to go faster if I listen to radio or watch TV while getting the beans ready for s morning pot. I like the easy way available to change grind type (fine or coarse). Theres something nice about doing a little task before setting up the fresh morning coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product with one minor flaw...
reviews.reviewText:
Works as advertised...
Takes some time to grind enough for one cup, prob around 4 minutes of cranking, otherwise good product...
The Cap and the Cup fit snug at first but will loosen with use, and that could have been a screw-on assembly for a better product, but now have to keep together with my hands... the cup almost fell out a few times...

It does grind your coffee, BUT!!! It takes forever and I mean forever!!!! to do it. I do not recommend this product unless you have a strong arm and ALOT of time on your hands. Honestly its not worth it.

I bought it for my boyfriend who loves coffee and needed a grinder. In Argentina we have 220V power, so I thought it would be easier get a non-electrical grinder. Big mistake. It takes forever to grind half a cup, and it's not practical when you have guests over. I'm so dissapointed with this purchase, I'm giving a 2 star review because in the end, it does the job (slowly, but it does).

This is the first time Ive ever owned a French Press coffee maker & was told that for the perfect cup of Joe, I needed great coffee beans; clean, pure water & the perfect burr grinder. Of all the burr grinders I looked at, the small JavaPresse that I settled on was the perfect choice. My new, JavaPresse burr grinder is attractive, compact & exactly what I wanted (needed). Thx JavaPresse!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great little grinder with a long handle
reviews.reviewText:
I'd have given this nice little grinder 5 stars if I could have it with a handle about 1/3 the length. Fine grinds take a while to spin which can be a bit exhausting with such a long handle. The resistance is light enough that a significantly shorter handle could be used requiring less arm movement and allowing for a faster spin. Maybe I'm crazy, though.

Other than that, the grind is great and consistent with enough variation to get the perfect grind for your taste or brewing style.

I am really impressed and touched with the level of customer service provided by the company. After the purchase I received email from Irene, who was assigned as my personal service representative - which I totally did not expect from a purchase like this. Besides checking on whether I'm ok with the product and have questions, Irene also emailed me a pdf version of the user manual and answered my question on resembling promptly. The grinder works perfectly fine for my first use today and I'm writing my very first Amazon review just to share my positive experience with this purchase.

Love the process of making a nice fresh espresso. However, during the grinding process, when I get up to about 8 grams ground, the bottom part wants to fallout, and it has once....always make sure to hold from the bottom or middle or you'll be cleaning up grounds off the ground, no pun intended.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good, inexpensive manual grinder - Arrived damage.
reviews.reviewText:
The grinder is a good manual grinder that is consistent. Maybe it's entry level for some, but does well for me.

The low review is due to a few of the ceramic teeth being chipped. I noticed after my third grind, when I decided to clean the grinder. Nothing but coffee beans have been ground so I doubt it was user error.

That said, chips excluded, the grinder works well.

reviews.reviewTitle: i wish there was some kind of guidance on the device itself to say "fine" "med" "course" I set it somewhere in the middle for my drip coffee and the taste of coffee has been a bit better than electric grinder so I am happy about the ...
reviews.reviewText: I may be doing it wrong - it's difficult to find the grinding size with the manual adjustment. i wish there was some kind of guidance on the device itself to say "fine" "med" "course" I set it somewhere in the middle for my drip coffee and the taste of coffee has been a bit better than electric grinder so I am happy about the purchase.

From the standpoint of finished product, this manual grinder is a big improvement over the electric blade grinder I was using. No more half ground beans or inconsistent grinds due to guesswork. I'm using a Keurig coffee maker with refillable k-cups and paper filters, so I'm doing a pretty fine grind. As a result, it's a fair amount of work to get a full hopper ground, but I'm very pleased with the results and consider the effort a small price to pay.

reviews.reviewTitle: The JavaPresse Manual Coffee Grinder Does a Good Job.
reviews.reviewText:
When I ordered my JavaPresse coffee grinder via Amazon, it was on sale at a deep discount. It's always good to save money.
The order was filled and shipped promptly, and arrived on time. The packaging was appropriate; the item arrived intact.

The grinder seems well made and seems to work well. The instructional materials JavaPresse has made available online are very useful. I was able to brew an agreeable cup of coffee on my first attempt. I've only used it for my French press so far. Haven't tried grinding for my Aeropress yet.

I'm still learning to use the coffee grinder, but so far I'm very happy with it.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's a nice compact grinder that seems to work pretty well
reviews.reviewText: It's a nice compact grinder that seems to work pretty well. My only complaint is that because it's so slender it's a real pain loading beans in to it. You almost need a funnel which is what I have resorted to. I have spilled way too many beans trying to load this from a resealable 2 pound bag. Otherwise I like it a lot. It is small enough to take camping too. Keep in mind that this is a pretty small grinder so you won't be grinding too much at once. It can only handle 1 french press worth of beans at a time, which for me works. YMMV.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great grinder for those on a budget!
reviews.reviewText:
This grinder is a great value, specially for someone new to grinding their own coffee. Had it dialed in where I wanted it by the second cup.

The only drawback is it can be hard to hold on to, due to it having a smooth texture, unless you have strong hands. A rubberized band around the casing would be a welcome improvement.
After much searching I am so glad to have made this one my first one. Easy to use and works really well. I definitely recommend it.

Was not expecting that a grinder could improve a cup of coffee, but it did. It's a bit of a time commitment to give up the electric power grinder to hand grind your improved cup of coffee, and is not always practical on weekdays trying to beat the clock out the door, but for those relaxed weekend cups of coffee, it is a satisfying new little ritual.

Used this for a year, but am finally giving up on it. It's built well enough, but the grind is super inconsistent. Regardless of the setting, you wind up with a mix of fine powder and course pieces. It's a pain to use, takes forever, and the handle pops off all the time while grinding.

wouldnt recommend. hard to get coffee beans in the grinder. takes too long to grind a very small amount. not worth it. other than that the material is high quality. but too expensive for taking 1 solid minute to grind 1 T of coffee

Let me start of by saying the customer service for this product is OUTSTANDING!! My original product had a small defect that caused a uneven grind. After reaching out to the company they literally had a new one at my door step in less than 2 days. Which by the way works PERFECT! Okay enough about that.. The grinder itself is a great grinder it does a very good job I wouldn't dare spend more for a hario or any other name brand for that matter! This does a exceptional job of keeping the grounds consistent I defiantly recommend this product.

We have had our grinder for about two years and use it about 4 times a week. It stopped working. The inside just spins and does not grind the coffee.

For the first two years it worked perfectly.

I've been using the new coffee grinder for a couple of weeks. I usually grind just enough beans for one or two cups at a time, and this mill has worked perfectly. Easy to use and love that there is no motor to suddenly quit working without warning as has happened with the last electric grinder. Would recommend this product.

reviews.reviewTitle: I'm pleased with this but it has some drawbacks for sure
reviews.reviewText: I'm pleased with this but it has some drawbacks for sure. Takes too long to grind for one. Every morn cranking for 3-4 min for a thermos worth of grinds. And maybe I'm just being a baby about this but it's a nuisance to disassemble and clean. I'm thinking at least this thing is built to last but only time will tell.

reviews.reviewTitle: Functional, minimalistic product; honest, personal service
reviews.reviewText: I ordered the grinder on the weekend, and was pleasantly surprised to see it at my doorstep Monday after noon. The product came in a minimalistic package. The tool is functional while being aesthetically pleasing. It works exactly as described. Thought was put into every part of the product, making for a great customer experience. Now it's noteworthy that the company is serious about their customer business. They get in touch with you and make sure you got what you asked for, then ask you how they can improve. Simple, traditional approach to doing business. I commend them for brining back the honest service. It feels good to do business with them.

reviews.reviewTitle: love the adjustability and the size of it
reviews.reviewText: Grinds well (although a little slow, to be expected ), love the adjustability and the size of it! Perfect for the traveling coffee snob. A few things I'd like to see changed if possible; I question whether the handle needs to be so long, I think it could be shorter and being the diy'er I am, I'll try another. Lastly is the way the beans are fed onto the grinder, I'd like to see the inner plastic piece slimmer and maybe more angled. Maybe a scoop that works well with the bottom canisters length and diameter? Other than those, I think the product is great. Can't forget about the GREAT customer service!

I bought this is a gift for my boyfriend and it was a hit! Fast delivery and great customer service! The product itself works fantastic and I am really pleased with my purchase. The travel friendly design is just what I was looking for as he takes it to work to use with his French press. It's simple and easy to use. I read that conical burr grinders were the way to go and we really like the sleek design of this one.
Works great! It does take a long time to grind coffee especially if you using it for espresso but for traveling its particularly nice. Plus, I think I found a mod to make it grind faster! See photos.
This is my second one of these (the only reason I had to buy another of because I lost the first one). Great grinder, easy to use

reviews.reviewTitle: worked well for 2 years then broke
reviews.reviewText: Not bad for $20, but it stopped working after a couple years.... the crank just spins freely inside the cylinder now. I normally don't review things, but here I am looking for a new one.

Have used the grinder daily since I've received it, no problems. I grind my serving of beans whilst my water boils. I used a keurig prior to grinding beans and using a pour over coffee system. I highly recommend this over keurig, I've been blown away with how good it is. Great company, JavaPresse. I only wish they'd manufacture in the USA. I'd pay double for that. Cheesy utube videos but I shan't hold that against them. Working great so far!

reviews.reviewTitle: If you want consistancy; look elswhere.
reviews.reviewText: This grinder works great for the first couple of weeks. Then the grinder wheel wears out to the point where the crank wallows so bad that you can see daylight around the conical grinder and a consistent grind is impossible.

While I liked the idea of a manual grinder, the inconvenience factor makes it less appealing than my electric grinder. It just takes too long for day day to day use. The product itself is made well and works as advertised.

qAndA.question: Would this work to grind smokable herb?
qAndA.answer: It might work but would be a MAJOR pain to have to clean all the time. You're much better off with a grinder made for that or even a grindr account

qAndA.question: Will this stand up to everyday use? i've read numerous reviews for other and they have failed after a month.
qAndA.answer: I've had this thingy since October (currently mid december) and used it probably a month's worth of use by now. Still just the same as brand new. Works just fine. I've used it for coarse ground for a french press, and fine ground for drip brew, good on both.

qAndA.question: what material is the burr made of?

qAndA.question: Does this grinder make your coffee taste better?
qAndA.answer: I don't think there are any grinders out there that can magically make coffee taste better, but this grinder does provide a much more consistent grind than my electric one.. which has made a difference in taste. Your ability to pick up subtle notes in your coffee will all depend on how sensitive your palette is
